Reviews.Title: “stayed here lots of times”
Reviews.Author: steve h
Reviews.Content: I often stay here as my company uses it for its employees and for the most part it is always very nice, comfortable, helpful staff. could improve the TV reception in some rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon tea”
Reviews.Author: Silvercouple
Reviews.Content: we had this experience due to the offer with Groupon and have to say we found it delightful. We chose the afternoon tea with cocktails and this cost us £25. We arrived just before 4pm (our booked time) and we were immediatly shown to our table, the room was lovely, just a few people were already seated. The waitresses were wonderful very polite and friendly. We were asked if we wanted our cocktails or our tea first we chose the cocktails and were given a menu to chose from, i had the pina colada and hubby had the woo woo, both were lovely(served in glasses and not tea pots as advertised but this was not a problem). Our tea was then served a selections of sandwiches, some small cakes and two scones with pots of jam and cream, everything was delishous. We chose to have pots of tea (though we could have had coffee) and there was a good selection of teas we could have had, being boring we just chose the breakfast tea. Again this was lovely and we were offered more if we wanted it, at no time did we feel rushed. The experience on the whole was a delight which we both thoroughly enjoyed and would without doubt recommend it to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Superb.”
Reviews.Author: sheila k
Reviews.Content: I took my nieces for a stay at the hotel as a birthday treat (they are both in their thirties) and we couldn't have had a nicer time.The rooms were freshly decorated with really comfortable beds and every facility-the staff were very curteous and attentive and the food was superb. We were allowed to leave our luggage in my room when we arrived,despite being early, and were allowed to leave it safely with the hotel once we had checked out which allowed us to enjoy London unencumbered. The hotel is situated prfectly between Victoria and the tube- just a five minute walk to each and a really lovely friendly pub was just around the corner. Despite being so handy for everything, the street itself is very quiet and peaceful and the standard of service we recieved was nothing short of excellent. I will certainly recommend this hotel to everyone and will stay in it again when I next visit London- one very happy customer!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Service Very Poor!!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the fact my family could not have dinner until 8pm limited what we could do in the evenings i.e. take in a show etc….! When I called the hotel with this is was constantly told ‘’we have afternoon tea for 200’’ on reflection if I had known this I would not have booked with you regardless of the cost. You should consider your hotel residents more carefully! When my sister went to have dinner they had to clear their own table before they could sit down, with items remaining where they had cleared them on to the next table – had to ask for soup spoons – and then knifes to eat their food! Their package did contain champagne with dinner that they never received or offered! When I went to collect them at 8pm – I was shown into a nice lounge area while I waited, asked if I would like a drinks and decided on a Gin & Tonic – only to be told we don’t have that!! But was offered a glass of champagne – when this arrived @ £9.50 it was flat and warm!!! I left half of it and we left. On Sunday morning they decided to go for breakfast – which was too busy and was told it will be about 30/40 minutes before breakfast! So went to the Carlton Tower instead for b/fast.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachel T
Reviews.Content: I went to the hotel with my boyfriend having bought a voucher via Groupon and were expecting a 4 star standard. However upon arrival we were asked to wait aside and had prompt the staff to be seen and allocated a room. The room itself would have had nice furnishings if it was not for the damage (cracked mirrors, water damage on ceiling, lights not working, draw wouldn't close etc...). The room was also very compact- not much room to circulate and really stuffy- we had to get them to turn the heating down twice to make feel as least comfortable in the room. The 3 course meal, which was included as part of our stay, looked quite basic on the menu but was actually very tasty and worth the price we paid. Another complaint would be on the security deposit of Â£50 which they 'blocked' on my card upon arrival. I understand that this is common practise among hotels, but there was a lack of information on what would happen with this when we left. I had to call them to reassure myself that the funds had been released upon departure. However, this money is still blocked almost a week later at the point of writing this... Overall a poor experience- poor customer service- food was good- room was average. Maybe worth going, but don't expect much from them.

Reviews.Title: “In a word... Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: K H
Reviews.Content: I would without a doubt highly recommend Tophams Hotel to anyone. The staff, facilities, restaurant and rooms are exceptional in standard. If you do one thing in 2012, visit Tophams, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “More luck than judgement”
Reviews.Author: rakeevil
Reviews.Content: Difficult review this one as we booked this hotel up hurriedly on the way to London staying that night via late rooms then read the reviews. Oh dear we thought and started to panic rang late rooms back up to say hopefully we could cancel due to the negative reviews they have had. Lateroom's got straight onto the case but called back five minutes later to ask that the manager was not in until tomorrow so we MAY end up paying even if we didn't stay. So I blamed the poor old husband and he took the ear bashing. We went and had a great day out then decided to check in to see what we had let ourselves in for. Firstly we arrived to see a notice on the front door to check in at Tophams Hotel no 28 instead of No 50 which annoyed me as we had walked back and lets face was this place was never going to stand a chance especially as when we walked into Tophams what a lovely bright, clean and shiny reception, so we negatively checked in for Belgravia Mews then to be told that Tophams was not fully booked so they had upgraded us to for the same price, I honestly saw my husband's shoulders lift about a foot with relief so went happily to our room No 4 which was in the basement opened the door and got a really pleasant surprise considering what we thought we would be getting!! then on closer inspection...... there was a really bad odour of damp/drains in the room, the shower lights were not working, a HUGH bath but the shower attachment would only work with the bath taps on, sealing and grouting missing in the bathroom, chips on the woodwork and the carpet could have done with a good clean, the mattress was so soft you sunk in the middle and then the air conditioning seemed to have a mind of its own. However remember we got this at a bargain price of Â£62.16 including breakfast so should we be complaining probably not! The next morning we remember the clonking noise as people walked through the reception area above but we had things to do so didnâ€™t want a lay in (good job really). We also then noticed no milk or English tea in the hospitality tray so ventured to breakfast. English breakfast luckily for us was included in the price although again I think this was because we had been upgraded as I heard someone enquire if they could have a cooked breakfast. The waitress obviously says yes but it was Â£19.95, thank goodness she declined. The breakfast was buffet style and when I got there they had run out of eggs and bacon, the rest was all being kept warm under not very efficient chaffing tins. The Danish pastries were excellent though so probably best to stick to continental breakfast. Summary: We did well in the end for Â£62.16 in the middle of London and were grateful for the upgrade despite the maintenance issues. The reason why I am publishing this on both hotels is to warn others not to pay TOO much for the Tophamâ€™s hotel as it does have its downfalls and perhaps try and get an upgrade if you are staying at Belgravia Mews which we could not fault as we did not stay there. All staff were polite but when we pointed out the smell issue not much notice was taken so overall ok but wouldnâ€™t pay over the top for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location on quiet street”
Reviews.Author: Kazza940
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall was very nice and the rooms well appointed and nicely furnished however quite small rooms - no need to put in quite so much furniture. Could have lost a chair and a desk/table in order to have more room for manoeuvering! Went to bar for a glass of wine to be told they only served sparkling wine and cocktails not normal wine - bizarre!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Tophams Hotel - restaurant with no wine”
Reviews.Author: clare g
Reviews.Content: First impressions on going into the hotel are very good. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The actual hotel accomodation was quite nice. Rooms furnished tastefully, although ours was a little cramped and very hot. So far, so good. We had our meal booked for 7.30pm (having preordered from a limited menu on a "romantic 3 course meal with champagne" deal with Groupon). We went to the bar at 7pm, which was not staffed, so we had to ask in reception for drinks. We were brought our complimentary glass of champagne. After making our way to our table, we asked for wine with our meal. Nope, don't have any wine. WHAT???!!!! have you ever ever ever been to a restaurant in a four star hotel in London that doesn't serve wine?. Ridiculous - bordering on the Faulty Towers. From here, it went swiftly downhill. The "carrot soup" was blended carrots, heated in the microwave and was the consistency of baby food. The waitress explained that it was "creamed" and this is how they make it italian style. Never had soup like that in my life. Gloup more like. Bruschetta was french stick, with a couple of mushroom, smoked salmon, very basic, very poor, very disappointing. Don't get me started on the mains, they appeared within seconds of the starter being removed. Lasagne was Findus like, microwaved tosh, with a few dry cucumber slices as garnish. No option to order sides, no fresh veg, no chips nothing. Chicken salad, plonked on rocket with some small cubed potatoes and cherry tomatoes. No dressing. Dry, tasteless non descript. Had better food in a Harvester. In fact, later in the evening we went to Victoria station and got an Upper Crust cheese and tomatoe roll that was infinitely better that what we'd eaten at the hotel. Oh and because there wasn't any wine (still can't quite believe it), my husband asked for a bottled beer with his meal, that was served warm, and in a warm glass. Classy. NOT GOT A CLUE. Fits of giggles ensued, it was that bad. On checking out we explained how disappointing the meal was and was told that they would tell the "management". The "management" needs a few lessons in how a restaurant should be run. This is a nice hotel on the surface, but that's as far as it goes, scratch underneath and it's not good. They are cashing in on their location and no way provide the service in the restaurant that you would expect from a four star establishment.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Manuela M
Reviews.Content: Originally I booked this as it was the closest to the The Apollo Victoria Theatre as we were going to a musical there. What a find, nothing was too much trouble and all the staff were very helpful. Tarni showed us around the hotel and our room. The afternoon tea we had was huge and lovely, the cakes and scones we could not finish they sent up to our room for later. The room itself was excellent decorated in a Parisian theme. Overall a wonderful place that makes you feel special. Much better than the Ritz which we stayed at the week before and not as pricey. Manuela G., Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tophams in January and had the best experience for a very longtime. We travel frequently and visit London often and wanted to try theTophams. The location is fantastic, right in the middle of Belgravia and overlooking the beautiful Buckingham Palace. We arrived and the first thingyou notice is how wonderful the staff are, they are genuinely friendly andseemed to really care about us. From the receptionist to the lady who gaveus a guided tour and offered us a complimentary glass of champagne, to theladies who serviced our room, everyone just couldn't do enough for us. Ourroom was beautifully decorated, I believe newly refurbished as well, room 5with a lovely King bed. The room was spotlessly clean and the evening turndown service was superb We had breakfast every day which was very good, all cooked to order and weparticularly liked the way the Manager recommended certain dishes to tryevery morning -a nice touch! We also had dinner on one evening and found the service to be impeccable and the food very, very good. The menu seems tofocus on genuine comfort food, well complimented by a great service. We had a thoroughly enjoyable experience. All in all a great hotel experience, not cheap but you would not expect anyless from a hotel of this calibre. We will definitely return. Victoria Lyndon, Oxford.

Reviews.Title: “English hospitality at its best.”
Reviews.Author: Martha P
Reviews.Content: Someone asked me to recommend a hotel in London and I started to tell them about the Tophams. Having stayed there, and at the time not having thought to put a review on the net, I realised what a great impression it had made on us and what a unique experience it was. Recalling the great welcome, fantastic location, outstanding attention to detail and superb customer care I though I really should let people know what a unique experience it was. The hotel is wonderful, situated in Belgravia and superbly decorated throughout I don't think you can better it! If you have the time, you really must take afternoon tea. Its in a class of its own! Don't hesitate to stay here. You will be looked after by some superb staff in a great hotel and I guarantee it's an experience you will recall with pleasure for many years to come. Martha Perez, Spain.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in no way worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Ellehaze
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were given a nights stay and dinner for his birthday from groupon. The value stated on the voucher was Â£264.00, which is ridiculous!!! The bedroom was tiny, hot and not entirely finished. The bathroom had an unfinished window and damp on the ceiling. For the meal we were offered a choice of three main meals, only one of them being vegetarian (unlucky for me). Our starters were brushcettas, which were dry baguette with tinned mushrooms, soft cheese and salmon garnished with dry cucumber. Main meals had been microwaved and again garnished with dry cucumber. Dessert was tinned fruit salad, with was awful. With the voucher we were also promised a glass of champagne, when it arrived we asked for an additional bottle and it was cava!!! On top of that a dreadful nights sleep in the sweaty little bedroom with the noisy lift next door, people stomping and slamming doors, I will categorically never stay in this hotel again. The staff were indifferent and rude, with the exception of our waitress who was a delight :-) Rubbish value for money, this should be a four stay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tea at Tiophams”
Reviews.Author: Cliint
Reviews.Content: A Champagne Tea for us at Tophams Hotel was a Christmas Present. Having seen the tea room on the internet, we were a little apprehensive and arrived not knowing quite what to expect or we might be the only couple choosing to have tea as a late lunch. A real Royal Welcome was given by everyone at the Tophams Hotel as they led us through to the last remaining table in the crowded Dining Room. The Waitress cam over and immediately made a wonderful suggestion that we might be more comfortable in the Bar / Lounge. It was certainly more comfortable for us in the cozy and homely Lounge. We were more interested in Coffee and Tea rather than the Champagne which we gave to another Couple in the restaurant. A tiered display of Freshly prepared Finger Sandwiches, Delicious Warm Scones with Jam and Cream, and a selection of Mini Pastries. A nice pot of tea and a particularly good pot of coffee with refills as required. We thoroughly enjoyed our Christmas present, which would normally cost Â£38, and the good service by all the Tophams staff.

Reviews.Title: “Traumatic tea”
Reviews.Author: Beatravels2
Reviews.Content: Was really looking forward to our tea day Christmas present. Despite the fact we had pre booked and had an email reservation the assistant demanded we get a bar code to be scanned. As it was a present we had to ring our friend at work, get her to go home and get her log in details to the groupon ap, download the ap to our phones, which we had to go outside for since there was no Internet, we were panicking because our phone battery was low, and once we had sight of this barcode they were looking for we were told their scanner wasn't receiving it. After 50 mins of this fiasco they finally said our code worked. We were in a small conservatory, we had to keep moving our chairs to let people pass. Very squashed in. We had a few sandwiches, one sandwich sliced up into fingers each, some small sweets, but no doubles so had to share each one, one scone each and one cup of tea. One pot made one and a half cups. No offer to refill or bring more sandwiches. Have been to many other London tea experiences and this one is not recommended. We enjoyed our day because we managed to laugh about it. I heard other people asking 'is that all'. Try grosvenor park lane instead, same price if you get an offer with a spacious room, pianist, refills and excellent customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and staff who cannot do enough”
Reviews.Author: R W
Reviews.Content: I have stayed regularly at this hotel for almost a year now and I cannot understand some of the less favourable reviews! Location is fantastic and quiet; the staff are always courteous and cannot help enough; and the rooms clean and comfortable with toiletries and tea/coffee-making facilities. I cannot bear the uht 'milk' provided in most hotel rooms but I ask for fresh milk and staff here always happy to oblige. For my most recent stay they upgraded me to a huge double room and when I found the tv not working, they immediately moved me to an equally nice room rather than have me wait for the maintenance person. Breakfast is buffet style and includes fresh fruit salad and delicious croissants. This hotel is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Champagne afternoon Tea for 2”
Reviews.Author: Barry S
Reviews.Content: Where do i start - My daughter gave My wife and i a present of a 'Champagne afternoon Tea for 2 via Groupon, and the wife decided that it would be good for her sister and partner to join us, so we booked another thru Groupon and booked for the Sunday the 19th Feb so before we went looked at some of the reviews which did'nt do it any justice and said it can't be all that bad, so we went with an open mind - The Reception area is pretty small and the toilets or should i say toilet serving the whole of the ground floor is unisex therefore always in use. We was shown to our table on time and received our room temperature Champagne about 10 minutes later - Plates and cutlery missing on table, Tea and coffee came along 20 minutes after the Champagne and the Finger sandwiches and cakes with scones showed their heads 45 minutes after we arrived - The filling in the sandwiches was very thin to say the lease, the cakes were the smallest and the scones were stale. Both of my daughters have been to afternoon tea before at other hotels and they sounded nice, but this one was not the best and would not recommed it

Reviews.Title: “Mixed emotions”
Reviews.Author: Pam S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well placed with a great exterior and very pleasant and helpful staff. It has the makings of a nice little bijou hotel BUT The dinner shouldn't really have that title- the hotel can provide supper. They also had no wine! We had a complimentary glass of champagne (Groupon offer) and bought one more each. The waitress went off to check if there was wine and came back to say that they didn't have any. Most strange. Our room was small but nicely reburbished with a clean and pleasant bathroom and small dressing table. Unfortunately, the bed hadn't been refurbished and it was like sleeping on a trampolene. We decided not to have breakfast there but at a lovely little deli up the road. The hotel has potential- but it has a long way to go yet!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, but the restaurant food/menu needs a little work...”
Reviews.Author: LuluOC
Reviews.Content: Our night's stay and a 3 course dinner with champagne was included as part of a Christmas gift off the in-laws. We arrived on Saturday lunchtime and there were about 5 other guests waiting to check in. As our room wasn't quite ready and there was a bit of a queue the friendly receptionist offered to take our bag upto the room and we could go off into London to enjoy the afternoon and come back when we were ready, which was a relief that we didn't have to cart our bags about all day. Upon check-in we were told we had been upgraded to a deluxe suite as it was an anniversary trip for me and my husband. Our room was just lovely, 3rd floor (room 303) so away from street noise, beautifully decorated, furniture was a bit shabby round the edges but I find this endearing. The shower room and seperate bathroom were down a small staircase in our room so it was more of a duplex apartment than a suite. The bed was very comfy, the whole room was spotless which is all I ask for. Dinner was a little bland, the starter was soup and one portion of that could have fed the five thousand as is was more than enough, the main was not what I expected, chicken breast on little cubes of roasted potatoes but was swimming in oil. It should have been in white wine sauce. Dessert was Tiramisou but was more like trifle sponge fingers with coffee powder and a bit of cream. The menu really needs looking at, but it was part of our gift so we couldn't grumble. I think if I paid for it myself I would have. Service was quick and friendly. Upon checking out on Sunday we were able to leave our bags at the hotel all day to spend another hassle-free enjoyable day around London's sights. Great location, 3 mins walk from Victoria tube station. In all it was a very pleasant experience and we would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No idea where to start!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dd43
Reviews.Content: I was in the reception at this hotel when the reviewer below voiced their disappointment to the receptionist and agree totally with the comment that they were ignored. The hotel is badly managed, badly maintained and the staff are atrocious. So where to start. The room my children stayed in had water stains on the ceiling, damp carpet near the fridge, we are not sure if this was as a result of a leaking bathroom or fridge. We requested an extra bad for a night and I eventually had to put it outside the room as it wasn't removed a day after it was used....we then had to move the bed from in front of the bedroom door for 2 days as that is where it stayed and the children couldn't get in or out of the bedroom without moving the bed. On about day 3 of a very long week stay my daughter finally took the toilet holder that had fallen off the wall down to reception and asked that it be reattached to the wall and two days later had to request again that it be fixed. Adding to the trials of this room was an airconditioner that had a mind of its own and either created arctic conditions during the night or was like living under a flight path. (we did notice in both our rooms that the airconditioners changed temperature on their own or turned on and off at will). The final straw came when the electricity tripped in the room and the hotel then became a family joke 'Fawlty Towers' would have been luxurious in comparison. So to room 2.........we asked for another room with 2 single beds and received a room with a queen and a fold out cotbed. The cot bed collapsed one evening and it took about an hour to get it back up correctly. The permanent bed was lumpy and I could almost feel the springs in it at night. One of the things that amazed me the most was the fact that there were no mattress protectors and 3 small pillows that had seen better days. And then there was the bathroom......bathgel and shampoo and small amounts of soap are hardly 4 star not even tissues on offer. There is no towel rack near the shower (except the broken one behind the door) and so the trek from shower to grab a dry towel each day was a pain. The reason we couldn't leave towels near the shower was that the shower leaked and the floor became very dangerous after the shower was used. The shower also flooded and on the second day I decided to try and find out why....I removed the drain cover and found a few years worth of hair clogging the drain...........I mentioned this to reception and yes the shower was cleaned up but seriously absolutely no apology just the offer of coffee. And now on to reception.......so many staff, no one had any idea what they were doing and they were all obviously stressed as it was a bit like watching chickens with their heads cut off. I hate complaining and as nothing we asked to have repaired while we were there was done |I thought this was a perfect venue to voice a few complaints. Oh and one more thing that I found incredulous...if one more staff member pushs rudly past me without apology (or for that matter allowing me the guest to go first) I am unsure what I will say. Such bad manners. Tophams pick up your game...stop blaming housekeeping and have a serious look at why people are writing negative reviews Oh and why didn't we move hotels? because the place was so ideally placed for all London had to offer and it was prepaid so easier to just use it as a place to sleep

Reviews.Title: “Superficial”
Reviews.Author: Jackie h
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Topham Hotel last night and our room was on the 3rd floor. We were greeted by friendly staff and given our room. We arrived at 11am so were pleased to be allowed into our room early. The room was very bright and clean and newly decorated. Excellent bathroom and furnishings... apart from the bed! The bed was clean but like lying on a layer of tennis balls with springs between them!! Lumpy, bumpy, creeky and tilting to the left so that my husband had to cling on to the edge to stop from falling off!! Our two cups were dirty and chipped. We phoned to have these replaced whilst we went off for the day. We returned 4 hours later and the cups were still dirty. Phoned through our displeasure and these were replaced within 10 minutes so no problems there. We then went out for the evening and when we returned the heating was not working. It was late so we didnt bother to do anything - as us Brits normally do - and got up in the morning feeling cold and tired after a very uncomfortable night on our very uncomfortable bed! Had to put up with noisy cleaners during the day time and noisy guests from either side and above - not sure it was their fault but think the walls were paper thin! We had a good cooked English breakfast with no complaints. We then went to check out and aired our complaints about the room to the American receptionist who took absolutely no notice of our tale of woe and in fact ignored us completely when the phone rang. That was that!! No offer of recompense - no notice of us at all. Such a shame as this hotel is in a fantastic location but they obviously just want the money without the service. Wont be recommending this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!”
Reviews.Author: 30andfreezing
Reviews.Content: We were bought a night at this (4*) hotel with a champagne dinner as a lovely thoughtful gift for christmas.. On arrival we thought it looked modern and we were looking forward to the evening ahead.. Check in was a painful process with the receptionist saying she was extremely tired because she'd been here since morning..It only went down hill from there! Our room was tiny and FREEZING cold, there were damp stains on the ceilings and stains on the carpets, we had a fire exit door in our bathroom which added to the low temperature of the room! We headed for our champagne dinner...we were shown into a room small enough to be someone's living room, we had pre ordered our menu for the dinner at the hotels request earlier in the week. Dinner was awful..the bruschetta starter was dry french stick served with minute portions of tomato, mushroom and salmon..the main chicken breast with rocket and roast potatoes - swimming in oil!!my chicken tasted like it had been boiled, I didn't eat it and was told by waitress that everyone likes their chicken different..some people like it with lots of sauce - I had ordered grilled chicken which did not have a sauce so I found that a strange answer! As for the rest of the night, I'm currently sitting in my room waiting for them to either fix my heating or move me..thinking we might even just go home!! WON'T BE BACK!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: michcolon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel via a Groupon voucher which included a night's accommodation and a 3 course dinner. We bought two vouchers and planned for 2 nights in January 2012. When we arrived for our reservation we gave our reservation number (noted down in my diary). We then got in to an argument with the duty manager who had our reservation starting the next night. All we had was the reservation number and not the email confirmation. She refused to check their reservations emails and sent us home at 10pm with no hotel room. She insisted there was no way their reservations team would allow a groupon voucher for a Fri and Sat night. We were also expecting a dinner at the hotel included with our voucher and even though we called in advance to check on the closing time of the restaurant - its open 24 hrs we were told (that already rang alarm bells) but alas, the chef had gone home at 9pm so dinner wasnt possible. So bags in hand and no dinner we went back home (luckily we live in North London) and surprise, surprise we found the email confirmation changing our dates to the Fri and Sat night so we were right, she was wrong. We called the hotel immediately asking for her to call us back in the morning when she arrived at work and forwarded the email to the reception. Surprise, surprise she never called back. So we called her. She then kept us waiting on the phone for 15 mins and finally came back to us to say their computer systems were down. By this stage we were completely fed up. Our weekend was completely ruined and we hadnt even got passed the reception area of this horrendous hotel and we were treated like liars and spoken to like we were completely stupid. Why didnt we read Tripadvisor before we went??? A very big lesson learnt. The staff at this hotel need to be fired and the hotel closed down. Do not go!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Living Social Champagne Deal”
Reviews.Author: M0rleySt
Reviews.Content: A truly awful experience. Â£28 special deal from Living Social for tea and Champagne for two. Sounds nice....wrong. It's truly dreadful. Upon arrival you are ushered into a small room away from the hotel and their guests. It's a purpose built extension, no character - more like a pub function room. I am sure if you are a voucher holder and seen talking to one of the paid guests you'd be marched off the premises! There is no cloakroom - you are packed into a room so tight, you cannot move once you have sat down. The waitresses (try hard) kept knocking peoples coats off the backs of their chairs, while other customers squeeze by trying not to knock your cutlery off your table. The champagne was not chilled - we asked for English Breakfast tea and got Earl Grey. No sugar on table, had to ask for it. Bread for the sandwiches was dry, filling was cheap and the small cakes tasteless. Highlight was the scone. Forget ideas of grand hall/reception area to enjoy your tea here - if you walked in off the street and paid Â£28 you'd feel ripped off. And this was a deal! Some good deals on Living Social - this is NOT one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience- Never go there!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. On arrival it was clear that the staff was unorganised and when asked how much the afternoon tea was, there was an actual argument at the front desk among the staff. Once booked in the room we received had a damp smell (not unlike England though, but would have thought a 4* hotel would not tollerate such an odour). There were various items in the hotel room that were not up to standard; there was a door knob missing, the shower door did not close, there was no milk for coffee. The following morning we headed to breakfast as the deal we bought included breakfast, but on arrival we were addressed in front of the dining room by a member of staff telling us that we were not allowed breakfast. Once she checked on the front desk and they dug out the package we paid for, it was confirmed. It was handled in a shocking manner! My husband was so humiliated that he went to speak to the manager only to be told that the manager was not on site, but that the staff member (who has been especially helpful I might add as a positive) will call the manager and they will call us in the room in 15 minutes. After waiting more than 15 minutes we headed down and she was still on the phone. We arrived at the front desk where the lady sitting at the pc kept on telling us that "everything is ok, you can go" and we responded by "we are waiting to speak to the lady on the phone" - this happened about 4 times - showing that they do not pay attention to the customer. My husband was then pulled aside once the staff member got off the phone and they offered to pay for our taxi, which we turned down as we were there with our car. They then offered us Â£20 for compensation on the breakfast and told that they will follow up during the week, needless to say we felt like we were bribed. It is Wednesday, there was no follow up. I would never pay to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.... everything else was horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Landlocked-crazed
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay in London at the Tophams Belgravia was a huge disappointment and unacceptable. I booked a 4 star propertyâ€¦ this hotel does not compare to the description. I witnessed many people complaining to the staff, and trying to cancel their reservations due to the unacceptable condition of the hotel. I actually felt sympathy for the staff, as it was obvious that dealing with unhappy customers was a common occurrenceâ€¦ they seemed browbeaten. They seemed to rely upon each other as they hunkered down behind the desk, holding firm on whatever direction their phantom Management forced upon them. Upon arrival, we were happy with the location and our initial impression, both the exterior and entry area, were very nice. Upon going to the initial room assigned, we learned the truth about the unacceptable condition behind the facade of this property. Upon asking for a different room, we too, like many people seem to experience, were led down the street to their â€œsisterâ€� property. After towing our luggage up three flights of stairs (no elevator or air-conditioning), we were led to a room that should have been condemned. The entire â€œsister-propertyâ€� looked as if it was infested and should be condemned. I actually looked around for cameras to see if we were on some type of prank television show. There were times I actually felt sick to my stomach by what I saw and smelled. I was traveling with my 69 year old father, and after one night at this hotel, we both wanted to cut our vacation short. We decided to stick it out (laugh it off , is what we told ourselves), and spent as little time as possible at this place as possible. The location is excellent, and provided us the opportunity to walk to all the sites we wanted to see on our first trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped-off”
Reviews.Author: Gerry_D783
Reviews.Content: I booked into Tophams Hotel using their own website for a dble standard room Â£163.80 paying a deposit of Â£19.66. When I arrived at the hotel at 6pm on 6th December they promptly debited the balance and then, only then, told me that they were overbooked and did not have a room for me. They walked me to dirty dank doss-house further down Ebury Street; when I declined to go in, on account of the smell, they offered me alternative accommodation at 'another 4 star hotel' which they owned at Knightsbridge Green. They offered to pay for the taxi. I had no other options so agreed to go. The Knightsbridge Hotel would not get two stars, never mind 4; cigarette burns in the bedding, torn lino, cold tap seized, no wifi, mini bar, cable, drinking water, third of a roll of lavatory paper, no coat hangers, front fell off trouser press when I tried that instead, and the smell.......... I promptly rang Tophams and they apologised and promised 'to sort it out tomorrow'. Despite countless attempts I can get no response and have not had the taxi fare re-imbursed, never mind my Â£163 which I consider to have been stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely on the surface -Completely overrated underneath”
Reviews.Author: Allie L
Reviews.Content: We booked the Topham's hotel on a special occasion, and were looking forward to it. The hotel looks lovely -boutique style, rooms look nice, staff friendly... But scratch that surface, and you come across small rooms, a bed so soft you sink in it sitting down, a cold bathroom (made of old beautiful stones but not thought through for cold winters), a restaurant that although serving nice food, feels more like a cantine and doesn't serve alcohol (nor does the bar?)... And the little things that make a difference... are non-existent: bathroom products are limited, only one toilet paper roll, tea but no milk, etc... Being familiar with 3 to 5* hotels, one can safely say that this one is far overrated, way overpriced -prices of a 4*- for really what overall is just about a 2*, despite its lovely looks. Thankfully we went on a special deal...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not much else in its favour.”
Reviews.Author: 186402Pete
Reviews.Content: To start with the good, this hotel is very conveniently located for Victoria station. That is about all in its favour. Having checked in, I took my luggage up to the room and had barely set foot in the room before the fire alarm was ringing. This was a minor inconvenience as I was planning to head straight back out anyway. When it happened again at seven o'clock the following morning I was less amused, especially when informed by a member of staff that it had been set off by someone having a shower. The room was quite poky, with no space to stand a standard sized suitcase that didn't prevent walking round the room. There was space on top of the chest of drawers, but this then impeded the view of the television. I don't think the television had been retuned any time soon either, so half of the channels were not actually viewable. The filter in the kettle looked truly vile, and there was some nasty damp coming through the paint around one of the light switches. The furniture in the room might at a distance have appeared vaguely elegant, at close range it would probably be rejected by Jordan as tacky. The desk had a nasty wobble as well. Finally the bathroom. While acceptably appointed, it was very cramped. I was unable to sit on the toilet without catching my leg rather painfully on the hot towel rail. While I am a little over average height, I am not a giant. The room smelled a bit funny as well.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: Tiina H
Reviews.Content: My husband brought me here for the night for my recent birthday. From themoment we checked in to the moment we left the service was superb. I can befussy about hotels, noticing small things that I would comment upon, but Ihad no negative comments to make at all about this one. The service was veryfriendly and personal without being OTT. Our room was large and comfy.Dinner in the restaurant was delicious, and the staff wished me happybirthday at every opportunity. I even received a card from them on the dayof my actual birthday. I would definitely stay here again when theopportunity arises. Loved it ! Tiina Hurt S. Suffolk

Reviews.Title: “Whatever you do - dont stay here - I didn't!”
Reviews.Author: AdamT7AHR
Reviews.Content: Booked through lastminute by assistant at work - looked OK on the web Arrived in reception looked OK - staff friendly, process swift. Alarm bells where ringing when on being shown to the room - was led out into the street and to a doorway about 6 doors down the road. Door unlocked and led up some pitch black steps up to a horrendous, dirty, worn and damp smelling room - I refused to stay and walked back to reception - was offered an alternative single room in the main 'hotel' - which wasn' en-suite - I declined and they arranged to put me up in sister hotel in Knightsbridge - which was also poor but too tired to complain at this point. Funny how staff did not seem suprised at reaction to room - suspect it has happened before on more than one occasion

Reviews.Title: “Ver y Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: aml110
Reviews.Content: I've booked the hotel via Grupon thinking to myself I was gettin a great deal! 4 star hotel, 3 course meal, champagne! Wow! I was brought to reality as soon as we walked in... Customer service was very unproffesional. The lady who checked us in was very rude, not only to us but also towards other staff who seemed very disorganised and stressed out. We were told that the hotel doesn't contact heir guests regarding their meal choices although I had clearly received an email asking what we would like to eat and at what time. We were told we couldn't have a dinner at our chosen time (6-7pm) and we would have to wait till 9pm as the restaurant is fully booked. We were offered to have our meal in our room. We agreed thinking there will be enough room for a table and couple of charis. There wasn't. We had to drag a little round table from the bathroom and ate sitting on our bed! The food was horrible. I don't usually tend to make any complaints, but personally I would feel embarassed to serve something like that to anyone! When we were trying to check out the next day we were totally ignorred by the receptionist who in the middle of conversation with us answered the phone and was too distracted to maitain any interaction with us. She just waved to indicate that we were done and we can go... I would not recommend this hotel o anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice decor shame about everything else.”
Reviews.Author: JUDE069
Reviews.Content: We used a groupon voucher to stay in london for my fainces birthday weekend. Staff were friendly on arrival and let us use the luggage room as we couldn't check in until 1300 which we were grateful for. When we did check in we were told we had been upgraded to deluxe double room 4 which we were excited about. The decoration was nice and room adequate. Only problem was that it had a real draft as was at the very front of hotel next to reception and extremely noisy. You can hear the front door going which appeared to be opening and shutting all through the night. The linen delivery van also turned up at 0700am and was extremely noisy parked right outside our room. It also unfortunately seemed to be where everyone went outside to smoke so there was always a strong cigarette smell coming in from outside. Not pleasant for non smokers. We chose to eat at 2100 in the restaurant and had pre booked meals 2 days before so they knew our starters , mains and deserts way in advance. Despite this we arrived at 2050 and were seated and given the champagne... They unfortunately could only offer tea or coffee or water to drink and had no bar menu. We received our starters 40 minutes after our arrival which was actually bruschetta and didnt require much cooking so we failed to see how they could have taken this long. Lasagne was standard and did not come with any vegetables or salad which you would normally expect. There were couples that arrived after us that we're on desert as our starters came out. In summary we were a bit disappointed with our stay and have read some very positive reviews from some on here so maybe a different room would have made for a different stay experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Truly horrendous and we didn't even get past check-in”
Reviews.Author: C M
Reviews.Content: Booked and pre-paid through lastminute.com top secret deal. Our attempted stay was on 10 November. On arrival at 10pm, decor looked ok. Very unwelcoming reception staff squabbling amongst themselves who took a while to notice we were waiting to check-in. There was then a disagreement about which room we had been allocated....more strained conversation between check-in staff. Our voucher was not accepted due to the hotel not processing the payment from last minute.com. Having contacted our credit card provider, we confirmed our payment had been processed, we had our hotel voucher and had expected that the hotel would resolve the issue.....however, we were advised we would not be allowed to stay at the hotel without paying for a night's stay- Â£250. Having already paid approx Â£570 through lastminute.com and in possession of our voucher and booking confirmation we refused to provide them with any further payment or swipe of our card. Long-story, short, we spent almost 2 hours in reception arguing with numerous check-in staff and the general manager (over the phone). The general manager was particularly rude, was not prepared to speak to me in the first instance and when he did he interrupted me constantly and actually hung up the phone on me. The check-in staff were regularly calling him throughout the 2 hour ordeal for advice; they are not empowered and were visibly scared to agree anything with us without speaking to him first. Finally, we decided we would not stay at the hotel (despite already having paid in full for 3 nights to last minute.com and having no-where else booked in London). Even when we advised the staff we were leaving and that we wanted a refund they would not even do this. We found another hotel and got a walk-in rate - at this point it was after midnight. The next day, I called lastminute.com and told them what had happened. Lastminute,com advised that Tophams should have contacted Lastminute.com using the 24 hour hotel support service they provide and the matter could have been resolved immediately, allowing us to check-in straight away. Lastminute.com provided excellent service and arranged an immediate refund. Tophams staff did try to call lastminute.com when we first arrived but they used the standard customer service number that shuts at 8pm, they told us they had no out of hours number that they could use. Despite asking the general manager to call me when he was back in the hotel the next day, I received no phone call and no apology; this is despite Tophams being completely in the wrong. The staff simply did not know how to deal with a situation that could have been resolved so easily via a quick call to lastminute.com out of hours service. Our experience at Topham's was absolutely horrible, we have recommended that lastminute.com take Tophams off their list of hotels offered and we would certainly advise other potential guests not to take the risk of staying here; clearly it can be hit or miss but when it is bad, it is truly horrendous.

Reviews.Title: “First hotel I have been in that didn't provide toiletries!”
Reviews.Author: matt246
Reviews.Content: Very poor service, atrocious food, no toiletries rooms fine for the vertically challenged but nicely decorated

Reviews.Title: “champagne tea”
Reviews.Author: 97Maggie
Reviews.Content: My husband treated me to afternoon tea at Tophams Hotel last week and we enjoyed a lovely couple of hours there. We began with a glass of champagne which was followed by an ample tea consisting of sandwiches, cakes and finished off with scones, jam and cream. Of course there was as much tea or coffee as we wanted. The atmoshere was pleasant, the service good, we didn't have to wait long at all, we were booked for 2pm. It did get busy later but we had no complaints at all. It's in a very quiet road near to Victoria station. I would recommend it to anyone. Linda W

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: Cathleen G
Reviews.Content: My husband decided to give me an early surprise and booked Tophams Hotel for my 50th birthday after a subtle hint from me. He booked a Superior Room for us and when we arrived we were given a free upgrade to the newly refurbished 301 suite of two separate floors and a spacious bathroom. We were blown away the second we approached the door of 301 and I had a great feeling we were not going to be let down. It was very kind of the receptionist to walk us up all the way and then introduce to the amenities in the room. It was definitely in tip top condition and met all of our prior expectations. Minibar, tea and coffee making facilities, iron and ironing board, bathroom toiletries, flat screen television and a feather soft bed. Moreover attention was paid to the Italian marble bathroom with the rainforest shower for two to the attention to detail for the use of the top quality bed linen and sumptuous goose feather pillows. Superbly comfy. The lounge room could have seated ten people, it had lovely neon green couch with matching cochins, luggage room, , delicious fragrance of the crunchy green apples on the reception desk, J Malone candles and fresh flowers. I could go on and on but all I can say is that I have been to many 4 star hotels all around the world that try to live up to the Boutique standard and not felt the way Tophams makes me feel with its warmth, personalised touch and extremely high level of service especially from the lovely staff and the warmth I felt when I stayed at the Tophams it almost made me feel I am not visiting but living Tophams. Cathleen G.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer-Rus
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at Tophams for work through a 3rd party website. The hotel is convenient to Victoria Station, offers free wireless internet and has charming decor. I was put in a basement room with a cavernous and freezing cold bathroom with a broken shower door. The shower head on the additional bathtub did not work, making my first morning's bathing ritual a challenge, and not the way one wants to start a work week when traveling for business. The second day, my shower door was still not repaired, but I decided to use it nonetheless. The smoke detector, installed right next to the shower stall, went off from the shower steam, waking up all of the hotel guests at 7am. I was interrupted twice mid-shower and told that I need to shower with the fire door (out to the main street) open to let out the steam! I insisted upon a new room. To the hotel's credit, they put me in a very nice room after the smoke detector incident, but too little too late. I travel to London frequently for business, and will strike Tophams from my list.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon Tea-very disapointed!”
Reviews.Author: aj1
Reviews.Content: We pre booked a week ahead for a table for 8 including four young children. We got to the hotel and were shown to the lobby if you could call it that, I know the Tophams hotel is a boutique hotel, but it was a small waiting area that hardly seated the 8 of us and there were lots of people milling about with luggage and no space for anyone. We were shown to out table, the dining room looked like a canteen and indeed we could see remnants of breakfast still on the heated serving area. We were offered juices instead of our champagne, juices were terrible quality concentrate, tea was mediocre with no "real" tea or sugar...no strainers, sugar cubes etc...all packeted goods and generally what you would get in a cafe. Our food took over an hour to arrive, even though we had warned of young children at the time of booking, the room was busy and we definitely felt it...the tables were packed in and with no cloakroom for coats etc...Made the room even more claustrophobic. After asking twice how long our food would be and a good 45 minutes later we were given half of our food, again poor quality sandwiches. The pastries and scones were ok and served warm. By the time the rest of the rest of the food arrived a good 30 minutes later, we had just had enough and wanted to leave. There was a four person queue for the one available guest toilet, we were then shown to a second toilet on the second floor....again not what I expected, one toilet for a dining room full of guests?? All in all a very disappointing experience and with none of the attention and ambiance that is usual at an afternoon tea treat. Very disappointed, especially after attending similar experiences in the same area/similar hotels and leaving feeling like we have had a treat. Would avoid and now know to check the reviews before I book.

Reviews.Title: “Economical Belgrave Victoria Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ian K
Reviews.Content: We wanted a place to lay our heads after a late night Burns' Supper. This was convenient for the venue and for Victoria Underground station to get back to Paddington the next day. Expedia got us the best price. Room was pleasant, if a bit cramped near the door. Big enoug bathroom with both shower and tub. Soft bed. Undisturbed night's sleep. Wouldn't want to spend a week there, but great for a couple of nights' sightseeing. If the price of breakfast is too high, there is always Wetherspoons at Victoria Station. Friendly reception.

Reviews.Title: “A Memorable Experience!! Definitely coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Alice K
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend decided to treat me for a weekend away in London for our anniversary, consisting of staying in a hotel, trips to restaurants and a night out to see Wicked the musical. I donâ€™t know about anyone else but I get very impatient with surprises so forced him to tell me at least where we were staying. He told me we were staying at Tophams Hotel, so straight away came on here to read reviews and see pictures. I wonâ€™t lie; by reading some of the reviews on here I was very very worried that my experience would not be one that I would like to remember!! Once arriving though all my worries literally disappeared. The hotel is hidden on a quiet road near Victoria Station, hidden from all the noisy roads, and has a tonne of restaurants in the area. The dÃ©cor is amazing, reminded me of Moulin Rouge â€“ very sophisticated!! The staff were very friendly and upgraded us on the spot when I mentioned that it was our anniversary. I did want to look at both possible rooms though (just in case!) and in fact found it hard to decide over a double room on the first floor or the suite on the second floor, they were gorgeous, clean and quiet! (I chose the suite though, why not!) We then went back downstairs and checked in (fastest check in to date) and went up to our room. The staff were helpful for the remainder of our stay, helping us book taxiâ€™s, made reservations at restaurants (We were originally going to an Italian but decided to change to a French one last minute). I am usually someone who doesnâ€™t like hotel breakfasts, but Tophamsâ€™ breakfast was amazing, definitely cured the hangover from the first night! Before we left we saw that afternoon tea was available in the hotel and thought we might as well kill some time as checkout was at midday but our train was at 4. The afternoon tea definitely topped the whole experience off!! My weekend was amazing; itâ€™s a weekend I will never forget. I do feel bad that the hotel has received such bad reviews but in my mind, when you have a good experience you donâ€™t think to state all the time that you did via reviews, but if you did have a bad time or even had a tiny thing go wrong you do make a big deal out of it. I advise anyone to stay, for couples I guarantee Tophams Hotel will make your trip away one to remember! May bring my mum here for her birthday in April, I know she would love it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic central location”
Reviews.Author: Alextodd
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Tophams Hotel in December last year. The reception staff would greet us by name and stop and chat with us during breakfast or while we were relaxing in the lounge with our afternoon tea. We knew that our room couldn't possibly be ready upon arrival from Heathrow Airport at 8 am but it was ready by 10 am! While waiting we enjoyed tea and coffee in the small restaurant. Our room was very quiet and off the main street and tastefully decorated. The bed was very comfortable and heavenly after an exhausting day around London. Our hotel rate included breakfast and we had a delicious and hearty meal to start off our day. The hotel is We will definitely stay at the Tophams Hotel agai

Reviews.Title: “Groupon voucher stay at Tophams”
Reviews.Author: Nicky H
Reviews.Content: We bought a Groupon voucher and stayed at this hotel from 14-15 January. I'm sorry, but the food was appalling, and clearly microwaved, despite what some of the other reviews say on this site. We waited an hour and a half for our mains, and I had a plate of beef lasagne, that was clearly out of a packet. The staff were as helpful as they could be but everyone in the restaurant was furious. One couple left before their meals and decided to go home as they were so appalled. The rooms are ok, but the finish on the work that has been done was poor. Cracking tiles in the bathrooms and missing grout, bed was comfortable and it's in a quiet area, but I really think the food was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel In The Heart Of Belgravia!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia S
Reviews.Content: My dear friend recommended Tophams hotel for my Fathers birthday and what a wonderful time we all had! We stayed for a long weekend and decided to indulge in The Famous Tophams Restaurant Afternoon Tea which was just delicious! Freshly made pastries, sandwiches, champagne and delicious fluffy scones with clotted cream and strawberry preserve-our favourite! Much to our delight when booking our room i mentioned that it was my Fathers Birthday... the staff remembered and brought out a beautiful cake with our pastries! All the waitresses came out and sang Happy Birthday, they made his day! The receptionist booked our theatre tickets and dinner for the next day which we thought was very sweet, so pleasant and helpful. Our room was clean and of such a good size, with lots of lovely amenities! The decor is modern and elegant. The bar area is beautiful and i noticed the tables were often reserved. The only thing i would say is you don't need to bring a car, everything is so near by so you can either walk, take a taxi which wont cost you much at all or hop on the train which is a few minutes away. I would most definitely come back to Tophams Hotel again, hopefully my husband will read this and book for Valentines!!!! Thank you so much for such a memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “A stunning example of a boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraWynn
Reviews.Content: Simply stated, my family and I enjoyed our stay greatly. Upon entering this gorgeous little boutique hotel, we were greeted with affable smiles and a thoroughly warm welcome. The creative blend of modern decor and period features were absolutely beautiful â€“ a fresh look one does often encounter. The clear, glass roof above the dining area ensured the room was fresh, and well lit, and we were able to make the most of the sunshine. The bedroom and bathroom, too, were both maintained to a high standard. Staff were polite, helpful and were highly accomplished hosts â€“ telling us, to name one, of historically renowned residents, such as Lady Thatcher, JK Rowling and Ian Flemming. The menu was promoted skillfully and the afternoon tea was absolutely delicious â€“ a true culinary masterpiece consisting of a three-tier tower brimming with numerous delectable delicacies; freshly made sandwiches with a variety of fillings, fresh, warm scones served with a generous helping of jam and clotted cream and, finally, artfully crafted sweets. The entire trip was a worthwhile venture and we would love to return sometime in the future. Granted, it is not a large and extravagant palace â€“ so to speak â€“ but it really did embody the true essence of what a boutique hotel should be. We do so look forward to our next visit, and would definitely recommend Tophams' to others looking to stay in Belgravia.Â

Reviews.Title: “4 star??? No way!”
Reviews.Author: Rickx
Reviews.Content: Reception - appalling. The receptionist first tried to convince me that I was actually booked into their sister hotel, despite having a copy of faxed booking and confirmation in front of her. Somebody senior intervened and said she'd got it wrong, and that they would give me "one of their nicest rooms" because of the confusion. This "nicest room" was in the attic, and accessed by a corridor so narrow that I could not walk along it with my small overnight bag by my side! (I am of slim build). (I thought there were building / fire regs covering such things). The room itself was the smallest hotel room I have been in in a very long time. Fortunately I was staying alone, although this was a double room. The wall mounted flat screen TV did not work so there was a second TV taking up most of the very small side-table. The toilet seat was loose. The tea / coffee facilities had coffee, but only a single Breakfast Tea bag. All I can say is that at least the room was clean. I'm afraid I would be nervous of staying here again in case I was given one of their not-so-nice rooms. On a positive note, the staff who served me at breakfast were extremely friendly and efficient, and the restaurant was bright and clean. I cannot for the life of me understand why this hotel is classified 4 star. On this trip I just needed somewhere to sleep after an evening engagement, leaving first thing in the morning, so it was tolerable. If I was on a more extended stay and expecting to spend any time in the room, or take my wife, then I could not consider Tophams.

Reviews.Title: “My Group on stay and dinner at the Tophams Hotel was magnificent”
Reviews.Author: Sergei N
Reviews.Content: I rarely ever write reviews for hotels I stay in but I felt genuinely badfor this hotel when reading some of the reviews below as I had a totallydifferent experience to them. I even find it hard to believe they stayed anddined in the same hotel as we did. On the day that my husband and me turned up, we were greeted well despite ofit was late evening and reception area very busy. The reception staff seemedto me pleasant and I must note I felt like a judge on the Miss World panel.They were all pretty as buttons. Smiley and chatty. We were then shortlytaken to our superb room on the second floor with a small but decent balconyoverlooking the main street. We were assured it would not be noisy as ourneighbours included Ian Flemingâ€™s daughter and composer Andrew Lloyd Webber.It could not get any better than that I told my husband. The room was of a very good size; wallpaper was fresh and fashionable,everything clean, no stains or smells (as we are a non smoking couple we cansometimes be put off by the smell of cigarettes left by previous guests butthis hotel did not have any dodgy smells). There was also a minibar withdrinks and snacks, menu for the dinner, hairdryer, and a telephone tocontact reception. When we called the reception to order our dinner we wereoverwhelmed as the hotel was serving that night freshly prepared Italiancuisine by the Italian chef. So we were told, and as it is our favouritecuisine we could not wait to try it. Bathroom was immaculate and it had plenty of toiletries so we had a quickshower and headed downstairs to have our dinner at about 8:30 pm. We were seated in the restaurant with very good lighting and observatory.The furniture was lovely and the silver cutlery well cleaned. No one couldargue it was of 4 star standard, in fact I would give it a half more for theservice we received throughout the evening and our dinner. Also I must notethat some of the public bathrooms in other hotels are appalling and dirty,so I was glad that the bathroom at the Tophams was well maintainedthroughout the evening despite of many guests at the restaurant. Having few sips of our Champagne, which could have possibly been SparklingWine I did not pay it much importance, as the atmosphere was warm and thewaitress attended our table immediately without making us wait. My husbandand me chose to order Bruchettaâ€™s as a starter followed by Beef Lasagne andGrilled chicken with rocket and potatoes. These were undoubtedly preparedfreshly; in fact I felt I travelled in time back to Rome where my husbandand me have been numerous times. Mouth-watering and I cannot seem tounderstand how anyone could ever think that the food had been micro waved. Iam an expert of Tosco take away meals. Yes my stomach can tell, and I canassure anyone that the food served in the Tophams Hotel is not anything butfreshly cooked delicious Italian cuisine. Even my nose buds traced down thearomatic smells that travelled up the staircaseâ€¦oregano, cherry tomatoes andbasil. To finish off our lovely meal I could not have dreamt of a better and moresuitable Italian dessert Tiramisu. Three words: heavenly heavenly heavenly.So light and sweet my taste buds had a party of their own. We were not there to celebrate anything in particular but it turned out tobe such a fantastic and relaxing evening that I would love to return for ouranniversary. Who would have thought these days that a 4 star, centrallylocated hotel would offer such a great deal with dinner included. I was even encouraged by the staff to book with them directly next time toreceive an upgrade on the room type and a complimentary English breakfast. Ido hope although that they will have the same dinner available, cheeky! Wewill most definitely return to the Tophams Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “â€œOne of my favorites in Londonâ€�”
Reviews.Author: Ivan I
Reviews.Content: I travel to London on business almost every month and Tophams is "my" hotel. There are a couple of reasons why I stay at the Tophams: great staff and personalized service; unique, comfortable rooms; and proximity to Victoria Station. They've got a cozy bar near the reception area where Iâ€™m usually having my business meetings. Nearby there is a broad range of local pubs and restaurants, which is of a great convenience. If you're looking for a friendly, homey place to stay on business, give the Tophams a try. It might be a bit expensive for vacationers but if you want to splurge a little and have a great location, I'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing time”
Reviews.Author: JonesRon
Reviews.Content: Interesting hotel with quite an investment in colour and design. despite being very close to bustling Victoria station Ebury Street and Belgravia is a quiet area. Had a very comfortable yet quirky room in that bathroom was at a lower level than the bedroom (Room 305) and despite being next to the lift it was quite quiet. Had a really good sleep. Well situated for access to transportation system and some interesting pubs within the confines of Belgravia. A challenge to find some of them tough!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Champagne Tea at Tophams to Celebrate my Birthday”
Reviews.Author: Debbie S
Reviews.Content: I had the lovely experience of a surprise afternoon treat on my birthday. Champagne Tea at Tophams organised by my sister. And what a wonderful afternoon we had. The staff and management of the hotel were so kind and helpful ensuring that we had such an enoyable time. The room where tea is served is so cosy and relaxed The tea itself was delightful with delicate finger sandwiches filled with scrummy fillings, various little bite sized cakes, topped off with scones, clotted cream and tasty jam. All of this was washed down with steaming hot cups of tea (with the pot being renewed as many times as we wanted) and a glass of crisp, cool champagne. Absolutely lovely. The added surprise to both myself and my sister, who hadn't informed them beforehand, was the divine lemon sponge cake they brought out for my birthday with everyone in the room singing happy birthday. This, together with the extra glass of bubbly sent over by the manager of Tophams, gave me such a wonderful birthday experience. Having also experienced Afternoon Tea at The Ritz and at Browns restaurants, both of which were very nice, I can happily say that Tea at Tophams gives you a more personal, informal feel, with both staff and management being so polite and willing to please us. A heartfelt thank you to everyone at Tophams for making my birthday so special. A definite recommendation will be given to all my friends and family or anyone else looking to arrange or experience a delightful afternoon out.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy stay in the middle of London”
Reviews.Author: Merle R
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends stayed there around the new years eve period, had very experience with that hotel- friendly and helpful staff, nice breakfast and good room. And very good location next to the Victoria Station, Buckingham palace, Big Ben etc. Stayed there one week and felt very cozy the whole stay!

Reviews.Title: “" A truly lovely experience"”
Reviews.Author: Leyla86
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the reviews below I thought it was essential I add mine and share my experience with others. I decided to treat my family to an Afternoon Tea at the Tophams Hotel following the festive season. At first I must say I was doubtful but it was a good deal and as it is many of us I decided to just go for it! On top of that I also booked a room for me and my mother for one night. The afternoon tea went absolutely well from start til end. The restaurant was super busy so we were seated at the bar occupying 8 seats and we shared 4 trays. Tea was hot and nice, sandwiches freshly made unlike in some other Mayfair hotels where they are prepared in the morning to be served in the afternoon, fillings of good quality especially the cream cheese, cakes of perfect size and my favourite of all macaroons which were the best I have ever tried. Last but not least scones were hot and soft. Very very nice. We were too full to leave anytime soon so we carried on talking and eating without being disturbed. We were even offered more tea and sandwiches at no extra cost. It was a special evening for our family thanks to Tophams and its staff. Moreover I would like to give a special thank you to a oriental lady at the reception who is obviously proffesional in her line of work. She was just increadible and so friendly! I can only wish that everyone gives it a go as I would recommend it anytime of the day!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best 4 star hotels in London I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Kersti B
Reviews.Content: The Tophams Hotel is perfect in every way. The staff are top notch; personable, professional and pleasant. Our room had a lovely view, was cosy and beautifully decorated and had a pristine bath. Bed was really comfortable. We were always called by name by everyone on staff. It was clear that whatever we might request would be done for us happily. Even my partners strengtheners were organised. The lounge, bar, restaurant and all common areas were beautiful and welcoming. I FELT LIKE AT HOME BY THE FIREPLACE. Literally like a guest in a private home. Afternoon tea was wonderful, finger sandwiches fresh, scones hot and jam delicious. A must if you have never had high tea in London!

Reviews.Title: “â€œA Little Gem of a Hotel in Belgraviaâ€�”
Reviews.Author: katlinort
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience we had at the Tophams Hotel! My husband and I have just returned from spending 5 days at the Tophams. We were VERY pleased! We had a Family Suite room where the bottom floor with a King bedwas for us and a rooftop room for our 2 children. Magical, we had so much spaice! The rooms was very clean and warm. We also had a balcony overlooking the quiet street. We just loved this small boutique hotell! Attention is paid to every possible detail, the staff were friendly, helpful and always very courteous. The breakfast was great-like my husbend likes-full english breakfast:) Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. Super location. Truly a great "London"experience!! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: PeterP977
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week and found it to be lovely. Staff were extra helpful and it's location was superb. The rooms are nice and clean and the breakfast was superb. I will definitely use it again when I'm in London.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel that feels more homely in the middle of the craziness of London!”
Reviews.Author: missgriffin79
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews but after recommending this hotel to some friends they pointed out the reviews on here and asked if I was talking about the correct one! I stayed in Tophams Hotel last week for 2 nights with my partner and we had a lovely stay. I loved the fact it was a small hotel and the reception is 24 hours so if we ever needed anything, we could just dial 0 on the room phone, which is what we were told when we checked in which I thought was nice. The room was very clean, had a very nice decor, not very big but we did expect that as its a boutique hotel. We stayed on the first floor and we had a small balcony overlooking the street which was quiet. The staff were very helpful with providing a map and giving information on nearby restaurants etc The train station is very close, its on the street parallel to the one the hotel is on so its great to get around and also Wicked is playing next to the station which was perfect for us. The only criticism I would have was it was quite expensive but I suppose that's London for you. All in all I had very pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: hilarywalker
Reviews.Content: I booked the room here in December when they had a special officer running so paid about Â£75 - for this part of London this was superb value. OK the room was rather small but the bathroom was a good size and the view of the street from the window was nice. The entrance lobby was luxuriously furnished, and staff on reception helpful if not over friendly. It may be worth checking when you book as some of the rooms overlooked a basement or a wall. All in all though, I would use again.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely birthday treat.”
Reviews.Author: PeacefulWarrior67
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend took me here for a birthday champagne tea treat. It was wonderful. The staff were so polite and attentive. The only downside was we couldn't finish all the sandwiches and cakes. Yummy !! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Afternoon Tea at Tophams Belgravia”
Reviews.Author: aishabp
Reviews.Content: Lovely Afternoon Tea at Tophams!! Nice, pretty setting with delicious food. Staff were polite and friendly. Venue was very cozy and welcoming. Lovely afternoon out enjoyed by all.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, rude, fraudulent !”
Reviews.Author: JayandKelly
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked this 'hotel' for a week but only stayed for one night as it was awful! It then took over a month, many complaints and intervention from authorities to get our money back! The room was up three flights of narrow stairs with no fire escape route, the room was tiny, dirty and smelly! We were expecting luxury but what we got was more like a youth hostel standard! The bathroom window was not made of the usual 'modesty/obscured' glass so my parter had to stand at the window next to the shower cubicle with a towel covering the window to ensure when I was showering no one in the building next to us could see! The place was awful and to top the lot, when we complained the staff were the rudest I've ever encountered! They didn't care, and their grasp of the English language seemed to diminish to get out of dealing with complaints! They refused to refund our money - close to Â£900! Fortunately, as we took pictures of the god awful place, and reported the breaches in health and safety we were able to initiate a formal dispute! This place should be shut down though, they are fraudulent, rude, and disgusting! I feel sorry for anyone who ends up staying here! I'd recommend anyone with a complaint about this place to contact trading standards!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Merike T
Reviews.Content: I was staying there for a week during a christmas and new year eve celebrations! It was really good time that i spent there. Location is great, it has shops, pubs, station *Victoria near by. Very friendly and helpful staff it did not matter if i had to borrow an umbrella or ask for information i got always some help. Breakfast is good, different juices, full english breakfast in a lovely breakfast area. Room was clean and roomservice always provided us with warm towels! Well in my opinion, if you will decide to stay there during your trip you will get great and cozy place in a super location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: jonwales30
Reviews.Content: A lovely, clean hotel with very helpful staff (there seemed to be an army of them). Although the bathroom was very nice, some of the fixtures needed fixing/replacing (e.g. showerhead that sprayed water in all directions). This is the only reason for me not scoring 5 out of 5. Bedroom was tastefully decorated in modern style with a plasma TV.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced and poor service”
Reviews.Author: Dandyquindell
Reviews.Content: Service on arrival was poor to say the least, the staff didn't know a thing. Our room wasn't ready so we were asked to wait in the bar but we couldn't have a drink. Decide to go out and come back an hour later, initially we were told they would put us in one of the best rooms they had, then told 'actually that wasn't ready yet'. So room 201, it was tiny, you could barley move we had no space to put our luggage, no milk, no price cards and no hotel info. However it was NYE, so we shrugged it off and went out, when we came back they wouldn't serve room service nor did the staff know where we could get something to eat from. We went to bed hungry. Room 201 has internal doors with 202 meaning you could hear literally everything! I didn't get any sleep as I listen to room 202, fart and snore, amongst other things. There was also a draught in the room, so when windy I could hear that howling too. I'm not one to complain or write a review but as I'm sat on the train home I felt I should share my thoughts.
