We paid a silly amount of money for this box room. I'd rather have a travel lodge at a fraction of the cost. Location was superb, minutes away from Buckingham palace. Also the Â£50 pre authorisation fee is a bit annoying it takes up to 2 days to be refunded!

Reviews.Title: “An unfortunately bad stay!”
Reviews.Author: cellini03
Reviews.Content: While there is certainly nothing wrong with the location of the hotel or the cleanliness/niceness of the rooms, the service I received from the staff was not particularly good and I am still waiting for a invoice for my stay which was over 1 week ago. I booked the hotel online their website directly and upon checkout, was given an invoice for the amount paid except for the deposit. On asking for a full receipt for the total amount, I was told I would have to contact some other company that I paid the deposit too. As far as I was aware, I had booked directly with the hotel and while their online booking system may pay some other company for the privelige offering this service to guests, it doesn't help if you need a complete invoice for the full amount. I was eventually told that they would email me an invoice for the full amount as I need this to claim as a work related expense. I am still waiting for the invoice and this is also after emailing the hotel to ask where it is.....still not response to the email and that was sent 10 days ago. Other minor disappointments were the mention of a bar in the hotel guide in the room, but on going downstairs to have a drink I was told they don't normally serve alcohol in the bar.....why is it a bar then? Decided then to have a drink from the mini bar fridge, but as there was no bottle opener provided and after waiting for half an hour and no one brought one up as requested, I gave up and went to bed. Apart from this bad experience that will hopefully get rectified shortly, this hotel is located only a few minutes walk from Victoria station. Price seemed good for what you get. Room was clean and had modern furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Claire S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tophams with my husband. We were a little bit confused when we arrived by the bad reviews but everything turned to be fabulous. Reception staff are kind and friendly always with a smile on the face. I don't know about other people but our room in the ground floor was quiet, spacious and beautifully decorated. Flat screen TV with DVD player, mini bar and complimentary Wi-Fi. We also decide to try their afternoon tea: gorgeous homemade sandwiches, scones and tea cakes with a glass of champagne for a reasonable price. In resume: I will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Bless the Tophams Team for providing such professional service”
Reviews.Author: lindawong-Singapore
Reviews.Content: We landed in London late evening after travelling almost 18 hours from Singapore and after some mis-communication with a nearby booking along Ebury, our family was left without lodging for the week's visit. Fortunately for the blessed people at Tophams, they heard our plight and did the BEST! They bothered to offer us lodging for 2 nights with the only smaller available rooms at last minute. We felt saved by the wonderful angels (beautiful ladies mind you) of Tophams. What strke us most was their Attitude towards offering a service beyond just a hotel reception booking; obviously this 4-star hotel has a 6-star service level. They were definitely distinguished by their genuine offer to help, always attentive, smiling and greeting you by name. Not only were the rooms lovely, but the ambience of hotel is charged with positive energy of style and class; distinguished, respectful and definitely charming by all standards. Not only did we stay the 2 nights, we continued with Tophams for another 4 nights of our stay in London, re-booking the following week for a family suit with a loft with our 3 teenage children adored. I am writing to let all know that what makes a difference is more than a very good room, it's the soul of the hotel managment and the team member, They definitely exemplify the highest quality service with genuine touch of sincerity not easily found anywhere in the world let alone London. Of course this is the place I will recommend all my family & friends to stay! Linda Wong & Family Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Confused By The Bad Reviews - Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: thorny23
Reviews.Content: Hello there, My stay at the Tophams Hotel Belgravia, London was for 1 night over 18th December - 19th December. I was a little apprehensive about this booking as I forgot about trip advisor for in-depth reviews and just went with the booking website reviews. Most of the reviews on TripAdvisor as im sure you are aware seem quite negative. I am relating most to the people who seemed to have ended up being stuck in a basement room or moved to a sister or annex hotel. With this in mind I emailed after making my booking ensuring I requested not to be in a basement room nor should I be moved to an annex/sister hotel as it wasn't stated that this may occur on the booking website. I had a response back within 4 hours of sending my intiial enquiry. Relating back to the reviews, I can honestly say I haven't had any problems with my stay at this hotel and would go as far as saying it is one of the best and more homely hotels I've stayed in. Upon arrival to a warm, well decorated reception area, I was offered a pastry and a seat while they booked me in. As I had booked at a special promotion rate I was subject to a Â£50 pre-authorisation fee for my room, I was happy with this as they went to the trouble to amend their booking details while I was present as I had mentioned that it was not clear anywhere. I was then provided with my keycard and informed where my room was (Room 304). This room was on the 3rd floor and I made use of the elevator, they should maybe move the Christmas tree from directly outside of the elevator as you couldn't really get by - minor really. I opened the door to my room expecting the worst but in all honesty it was lovely, a little small but it was a single room (despite a double bed) and more than adequate. I decided to have a little look around, noticing that the room had air conditioning, a flat screen digital tv on the wall, adequate lighting, a soft-drink mini-bar, tea and coffee facilities and shower items - shampoo & shower gel. In a cupboard near the bathroom was a small iron and ironing board, something you don't often find in many hotels. The room also came with a hair dryer, although this was found in a draw in the bed side units. The bathroom consisted of a standard walk in shower unit which was simpl wonderful, the pressure was perfect and the temperature easy to set. The room was well ventilated and roomy with 2 large towels, a floor mat and 2 smaller hand towels. I needed to use the Wi-Fi and found this a breeze to get onto also, the network ID is Speedway, this opens up a wi-fi portal site informing you the wi-fi is free to use, it's very quick too. I also felt a little warm as had been rushing about on the tube so decided to open my window...low and behold you could open it fully, a miricale in the hotel world it would seem! The bed is extremely comfy and slept like a baby, pillows a plenty and also had a winter fleece thing stowed away in the cupboard with the iron and safety deposit box. Breakfast is served from 7-10am and is well set out. Most rooms come with a free continental breakfast which includes your usual pastries, cereals, toast, tea, coffee and fruit salad. The dining area is very well laid out and the food was very nice. As I said, I cannot fault this place and would certainly stay here again should I visit London. It's in a great location with minimal noise, great reception staff, adequately sized rooms and generally a lovely place. If there is one criticism of the place it would be the lack of information in the room, no prices for the mini-bar, no room service menu and no local information, oh and 2 of the lamps in the room were missing bulbs. That said, a pleasent stay, and a peaceful nights sleep, perhaps my emails before hand might have put them on edge a little and assigned me a better room than what some people have experienced. I really would visit here again as it is lovely and at the price I paid for the room I really cannot fault it. Regards Sam

Reviews.Title: “A champagne tea to celebrate my friend's 70th birthday.”
Reviews.Author: Frances O
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed by a friendly receptionist and went through to the dining room which was cosy and attractively arranged. The champagne was a delightful way to begin a delicious and beautifully served tea and the staff were friendly and first class. The icing on the cake came after we had finished when they appeared with a large delicious chocolate cake alight with candles and brought it to my friend. It was a totally unexpected bonus and was greatly appreciated. Altogether a fabulous experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't do it”
Reviews.Author: golfingmates
Reviews.Content: Booked under --------- - supposedly a four-star upgraded boutique hotel. It really isn't. It really, really isn't. I was marched 30 yards down the road to the Belgravia Mews hotel. Down a stinky hallway and the stench continued downstairs. Dingy room. Not one coat hanger in the wardrobe. Shower door missing. Horrible mattress. Still trying to understand why I stayed. Maybe I had to experience it in order to save others. I've quite often used ------ but not sure if I will so so again - they shouldn't be guiding customers towards the Tophams of this world.

Reviews.Title: “..most disconcerting hotel experience I have ever had....”
Reviews.Author: Jillian H
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel and have been meaning to post a review with some time but having just read other travelers reviews I have decided to procrastinate to longer. Having booked a "top secret" four star hotel in Knighstbridge through lastminute.com, I arrived at my hotel following a long haul flight at nearly 11pm. On arrival I was told there was a "power outage" in some of the rooms and I would have to be transferred to another hotel in Victoria. A taxi was called to take me there. Whilst I awaited my taxi, alarm bells were already ringing and things went from bad to worse quickly. Arriving at the second hotel, which happened to be Tophams hotel I was ushered to a separate annex and down a dark, dreary basement-like staircase (where just to add effect a mattress was thrown against the wall on the landing) to a dark basement room with no windows, no light in the room aside from one functioning lamp and a dim light in the bathroom, an nonfunctional phone, no internet access, cold/unwelcoming decor.... without exaggeration it was the most hideous room I had ever been in and I felt very unsafe. I used my mobile to ring reception to ask to be moved to no avail and spent a very anxious night before packing my bags as early as possible and insisting I be moved the next morning. It is difficult to truly describe how awful this basement room was, it felt to be descriptive "brothel like". Being a lone female who travels regularly to London I was truly shocked by the experience. I received a complimentary breakfast whilst I waited to speak with a manager who never appeared and I was placed in a much more amenable room at approx 10am the next morning. I do however have to caution paying clients against this unethical and highly unpleasant practice and would hope that hotels involved in such practices as I have described would be vetted and removed by lastminute.com, so as to spare other travelers the unease of such an experience.

Reviews.Title: “A bitter disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Mark D
Reviews.Content: Visited the Tophams Hotel on the evening of 7 December with work colleagues for a one night stay whilst attending a corporate event in London. What a let down! For a 4 star hotel this place leaves a lot to be desired! Everything looked great on arrival as we entered a rather delightful entrance and reception area. But this would prove to be the best experience we would get of the Tophams Hotel. Firstly our check in process was interrupted by a fellow resident who had a rather long list of complaints about her room. Hardly a good omen! Then, after it took the hopelessly inadequate reception staff a full 35 minutes to check our party of 8 in, and we had bartered with them to try and upgrade (unsuccessfully in 5 instances) the single rooms we had all been allocated into doubles, we were taken to our rooms one by one. I arrived at my room (room 209) to find it was barely big enough to swing a rat never mind a cat! The room itself contained a single bed, 2 small bedside cabinets and....well....nothing else! The built in wardrobe contained no coat hangers, the ceiling light was a bulb on a wire with no shade and the lamp did not work and, incredibly for a 4 atar hotel, no ensuite bathroom! The bathroom was a shared one down the corridor. The lack of ensuite bathroom meant there was no running water in the room, yet there was a kettle!! With tea and coffee but no milk!! Presumably I was expected to trek down the corridor to the bathroom to fill my kettle? Perhaps the milk was in the bathroom? Perhaps I should have looked!! :) I would later find out that some of my colleagues rooms were litttle better, one actually arriving in his room to find a pile of dirty linen on the floor!! So leaving the room for our evening event, we comforted ourselves in the knowledge that at least there would a nice warm bed to return too later that evening and a nice breakfast to set us on our way the following morning! But the disappointment was not over! On our return to the hotel we asked the staff if there was a bar nearby we could go and get a drink. They were less than helpful! Then we asked if we could have a drink in the hotel. We could.....so long as we liked rose sparkling wine!!! There was nothing else apparently. I retired to my rat pen of a room and looked forward to breakfast. I arrived at breakfast to find my colleague receiving his upgraded full English! Â£20 of wholesome breakfast! But no! The large food warmers were kept warm using a candle!! At least it was a 4 star candle!! The breakfast arrived cold on an even colder plate. My colleague complained, the breakfast was replaced with one of the warm variety and after eating his way through half of it he discovered a rather uncooked pink sausage!!! At this point he, and the rest of us gave up, checked out and headed to Kings Cross. I have never looked forward to an East Coast mainline breakfast as mch in my life!! Not a good experience. Not a hotel we will use again and not one I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Desperately Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: skirling
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Tophams many times under previous management I was excited to try it again when looking for a last minute hotel in London after its complete refurbishment under new owners. The pictures on the website looked lovely but when I arrived, quite late but I had warned them, I was shunted down the road to an annexe. There was just a flimsily locked door with no night staff, one reason I always stayed there was because it was small and friendly and there was always someone on the door so as a lone female traveller I always felt safe. The shower room had a large uncurtained window on to a road with houses opposite. The light above the sink, which had no plug, was broken, and the toilet cistern was adrift from the wall. In the morning there was no water, hot or cold. In the room both twin beds were broken, the TV remote did not work and the carpet was badly stained. The decor was ghastly and there was no furniture apart from the beds. I packed my bag in the morning and refused to go back. My compensation was being allowed full rather than continental breakfast for which the charge is normally Â£19. Cooked breakfast consisted of 2 chaffing dishes with a candle under them with nasty prepared, scrambled egg etc, already cold by 7.30am. The second night I was in the main hotel which was a great deal better, hot water, curtains, decent furniture, although the rooms are a bit soulless compared with the cosiness I remember when they were about a quarter of the price. Noise from the room above was noticeable. Good location, helpful young girls in reception and at breakfast, but really not worth the money and avoid at all costs being in the annexe!

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag...”
Reviews.Author: strongma
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed here for 4 uncomfortable nights. Located just a couple of blocks from Victoria Station, this hotel was easy to walk to and easy to find. Upon entering the small lobby there were 5 women working the single check in desk and the atmosphere felt very busy. We were quickly helped and checking in was a snap. We were informed that they had goofed and didnâ€™t have a room with two beds that we had paid for (there were two of us staying in the room) but not to worry they had fixed the problem and put a second bed in our small room. What a joke. The bed they included in our room made the room so crowded you could hardly walk to the bathroom without moving things. The new bed turned out to be a small metal cot frame with a 2-inch thick mattress. The center bar to the cot frame was broken/bent in such a way that it stuck up into your back and made it absolutely impossible to put your full weight onto the mattress and fall asleep. In the end the frame was removed and one of us ended up sleeping on the floor. The hotel apologized but had no other way to help us and expected us to be happy about that and stop complaining. So in the end we had to choose between staying or going someplace else and loosing the money for the unused nights. We decided to stay rather than spend double for the rest of our trip. On a side note most nights I noticed that they had overbooked and had to turn guests away to a cheaper hotel for the same price. They werenâ€™t that friendly to the guests they overbooked and acted like they had done nothing wrong and that the guest should simply accept their accident (or standard practice) and smile. Had we been given the correct room I would have rated this location higher as the main bed was comfortable and the room looked nice, but their â€œmistakesâ€� and lack of responsibility or caring has led me to believe they are not there to give a guest a pleasant stay, only make a quick buck. I would stay elsewhere unless everything else is sold out.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon tea”
Reviews.Author: Kay R
Reviews.Content: I treated my best friend to afternoon tea at the hotel,using a KGB voucher. On arrival we were shown straight into the restaurant which was small but as there was only one other couple having tea,it wasn't over packed! The staff were extremely friendly & very attentive at all times. I was disappointed that tea bags were used,even for the Earl Grey.The cake stand arrived with a choice of three types of finger sandwiches(menu says four), a selection of very mini cakes & two scones with jam & cream.The cakes were nice enough but we felt that homemade ones would have been nicer.We had plenty to eat & when my friend asked for more cakes(well,it was her 50th!!) they brought another plate full without any quibble.We both enjoyed the experience but I felt that whilst I was happy to pay Â£19 each, I would have been unhappy with the quality for the full price.Whilst we were in the restaurant there seemed to be a meeting going on in there & the group was very loud & did intrude on our conversation.The number of people grew & at one point someone was sitting so close to me,I felt that I was part of the meeting!! Overall an average afternoon tea experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be talked into going to their 'sister hotel'”
Reviews.Author: Walter186220
Reviews.Content: On arrival I was told that they had water problems & that the only room available didn't have a bathroom. They paid for a cab to the sister hotel in Knightsbridge, there was apparently only one room available, it was terrible. When I phoned Tophams they said I had no choice. I told them I was coming back & they had to sort it out. After a fair amount of discussion I got back and a room had materialized, it was what I expected & had paid for. There were no water problems. It was lucky I arrived early & was prepared to be insistent, but it was a waste of time & I could really have done without the hassle. I feel I got this kind of treatment because I had a deal through an internet booking site.

Reviews.Title: “Tophams Trip”
Reviews.Author: Giantclam
Reviews.Content: My son and I booked a Late Rooms deal with this hotel for Sunday night. The staff were welcoming and even though we arrived around 7.30 pm we were offered a free glass of champagne and a pastry/piece of fruit if we'd wanted one. The decor of the hotel I would describe as Russian, very much OTT but the room was roomy, as well as the bathroom. Nice walk in shower but only one tiny hotel sized bar of soap between us. The staff were very helpful and we left our bags there the next day - thank goodness, because we went round Parliament and they don't allow any large bags. We didn't sleep that well unfortunately, due to the rock hard beds and the pillows weren't great either. However, it was great value, clean, stylish and a very good continental breakfast with a real coffee espresso. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe they are still offering afternoon teas...”
Reviews.Author: CRTLondon
Reviews.Content: The afternoon tea we had here was atrocious. Poor service, abysmal sandwiches and shop bought, cheap cakes. Yet they are still selling "reduced cost" afternoon teas through Groupon. I would strongly advise against going there for afternoon tea as I wouldn't return even if they offered to give me afternoon tea for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great sleep, staff situation a bit odd”
Reviews.Author: kimberleyy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tophams Hotel Belgravia for one night with my mom in October 2011. I booked the hotel online on a website that showed mostly all favourable reviews, after reading TripAdvisor, I was a bit apprehensive, however all ended well. We arrived in on the train from Manchester before 8am and headed straight to the hotel to drop off our luggage and see when our room would be ready. The staff at the front desk were friendly, but seemed a bit disorganised. They told us our room would be ready in an hour so we left our luggage with them and headed out for breakfast. We returned awhile later and our room wasn't ready yet so we headed back out again returning in the late afternoon. Our room was ready, and I was very happy to find it was in the main part of the hotel (I was VERY worried our room would be in the old part that I read such poor things about). Our room was clean, warm, and tucked nicely in the back on the ground floor. The bathroom was very clean, water was hot, and there were plenty of towels. We had a nice rest for a couple of hours, it was quiet and relaxing. When we headed out in the evening, the salon off the lobby was beautifully lit with candles in hurricane vases, the fire was on and it was just lovely. I did notice that much of the same staff was still there as had been early in the morning when we arrived. Upon our return later at night, this was still the case. We had a great sleep - absolutely NO noise or disruptions, we were warm and the bed was comfortable. As we were due to take the train back to Manchester later that evening, we checked out first thing in the morning and again left our luggage in storage to pick up later. Check out was easy, our room had been pre-paid and that was that. However - the the same girls were working in the morning as had been all day into the night. We collected our luggage in the evening (same staff again), and were on our way. I did overhear another guest complaining about the breakfast having been cold in the morning and the staff (now including an older gentleman who appeared to be the owner/manager) weren't handling it very well. I cannot remember if breakfast was included in our room rate, in any event we chose to eat away from the hotel. We did use the coffee & tea supplied in the room and that was fine. All in all our stay at Tophams was absolutely great - no complaints from our experience, the negatives I write about were strictly observational.

Reviews.Title: “A good night's sleep in London”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: Booked a Sunday night at Tophams using an internet booking site. Got a good rate with breakfast so booked. Then read some Tripadvisor reports which made me wonder what I had let myself in for. I need not have worried. Check in was quick and easy with a nice friendly receptionist. I was upgraded to a double room on the top floor. A previous guest had removed the batteries from the safe but a very friendly and helpful member of staff soon had them replaced. The room was comfortable and well appointed and the bathroom was good too. The continental breakfast was fine - all in all a nice experience at a good price. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but poor customer service & a terrible night's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: HayleyHunt
Reviews.Content: The Tophams Hotel is situated just minutes away from Victoria coach station, in the heart of Belgravia - which was perfect for us. On arrival, the staff were not overly friendly (a smile would have been nice!), but we were able to check-in to our room early, which we were very grateful of. The room was lovely, nicely decorated with a bath and separate shower cubicle - useful ironing board & hairdryer - and a flat screen tv. Unfortunately, we could hear every door bang shut, and every footstep from the floor above us - meaning no sleep until about 3.00 in the morning - followed by the fire alarm going off 5 or 6 times (for 10 seconds each time), at 7.00 in the morning. Needless to say, we were exhausted the next day which spoiled our weekend. Breakfast was included (otherwise Â£15.00 for Continental / Â£20.00 for full English) - this was ok, there was a selection of muffins, fruit, cereals, yoghurt and toast - but not worth Â£15.00 if you were paying. On departure, we left our bags in the 'left luggage' room. When we came to collect these later in the day, we were made to feel like we were being a burden on staff, and they were reluctant to let us use the toilets - which even resulted in a male member of staff (assuming the manager) following my husband, and checking in the toilets when he came out!

Reviews.Title: “A night to remember”
Reviews.Author: kuldazed
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked this hotel after our whirlwind tour of Europe and just because it was near Victoria station. It was a nice finish to end our trip, no regrets! The room was excellent, in semi Victorian-like furnishing, with a very comfortable bed that just envelops you and a good-sized bathroom, equipped with bathtub and hair dryer. Reading other people's review, I was surprised that the other rooms were not that up to standards. But we got a room on the 1st floor, overlooking the streets (i think room 109). I absolutely love the bed, the wallpaper and the chandelier on top of the bed. It is definitely a boutique hotel and we also love the quirky and victorian-like furniture and ornaments in the lobby/dining/mezzanine area. The only downside is perhaps the room is a little small for luggage! But to be fair, we were lugging 4 pieces of luggage of which 2 of them is the big-sized suitcases. That leaves little room to maneuver around the room, but otherwise we could live with that.

Reviews.Title: “Beware, its a classic bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: Offbway
Reviews.Content: Had a reservation for their main Hotel, which they claimed was full. They walked us down the block to another Hotel. Not only did it not have the promised amenities ( not even an elevator), it was a basement room smelling of mildew.After much complaint they found us a room in the main hotel in another basement room. I won't bore you with the legion of problems ( non working lights, loose plumbing,bad mattress etc.) ,but the capper was my IPAD got stolen as well.Stay away both the couples before and after us who checked out had their own lists of complaints as well.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, finish not 4* standard, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: sam j
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel, service was OK at best during check in. I was escorted to the room to be fair. Got to the room which to my surprise did not even have a bathroom (or sink) in it and i had to use a bathroom which was located up a short flight of stairs round the corner from the room. The finish in the room was poor, with exposed wires up the wall leading to the TV, cracked skirting boards and not even a mattress protector for the bed. I was very surprised to hear that the hotel was only refurbished in 2008! The room did not even have a telephone in it to contact reception and no guest welcome book or letter. My key card stopped working and when i had left the room to take a shower and could not get back in, my only option was to go down to reception in my towel in order to get the card fixed! This happened not once, but twice during my stay. When i asked why it stops working i was told that i had kept the card too close to my mobile phone! The lift was extremely temperamental and often did not want to work. When i told reception about this they told me i would just have to wait. There was no room service (something you would expect from a 4*) and the noise throughout the early morning and the day time was crazy. Doors slamming very loud and lots of banging on the floor. However, by far the worst part of my stay was the fact that the loudest fire alarm i have ever heard was located in my tiny room and rang each morning at a ridiculous time. This really did make for a terrible start to the day. On the plus side, the location is good in Belgravia and the hotel is very close to Victoria station. I know though that there are far superior hotels in this area for a similar price. The hotel is really not up to 4* standard, is overpriced and i would advise people to look at alternatives in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that doesnt care about its guests!”
Reviews.Author: Guest556
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately despite the impressive impression one gets when considering booking this hotel on the Internet the reality is something very far removed from that. I booked a room via late rooms in October, paying the full cost upfront. However, on arrival and after being given the keys to the room I found that somebody else was actually already in the room causing much embarrassment. When i was "instructed" to return to reception by a super rude receptionist I was told there was no room in the inn and asked to leave. Thats right, asked to leave. I eventually managed to persuade the front desk that I had paid up front for this room and had nowhere else to do and for them to suggest moving me on to a sister hotel in Knightsbridge. The sister "hotel" however was a considerable step down (That is being generous) in quality and offering none of the benefits which I was originally attracted to in the first place. So, in light of the above most people would feel hard done by and expect some form of refund or apology from the hotel. Nothing of the sort. In fact in over 7 weeks of attempted correspondence not so much of an acknowledgement. I am considering sending in the guys from Rogue Traders. Appalling service, total and utter disregard for guests, avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Attention”
Reviews.Author: Beyondeve
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in London for a social weekend away. I gave him some hotels to look at and he chose this one. It is a very attractive hotel with an excellent location for Victoria train and coach stations being just around the corner. However, the website says there is a full English breakfast but when we booked there was no online option for this to added on and we expected that as we were having the deluxe room it was included in the package. That was not the case and it was never offered to us. On arrival the receptionist took our payment and immediately after charged us an EXTRA Â£80 'pre booking confirmation'. We are still trying to work that one out but have been reassured it will be refunded. Our room was reasonably sized and wonderfully decorated but something was missing. The tea and coffee making facilities had only two coffee sachets and two tea bags, lots of sugar (which we don't take), NO milk and no spoons. In the bathroom, the complimentary quality toiletries were one tiny shampoo and matching shower gel and one tiny piece of soap. The light bulb over the bath had blown and the dressing desk lamp didn't work even after we changed the bulb. The other annoying thing was the lack of a hairdryer. My husband got onto the phone and requested the missing milk spoons and hair dryer and mentioned the non-working lamp. A while later, someone arrived with two spoons. Again we mentioned the missing milk and coffee/tea. They were brought up later on a plate. We reminded them about the hair dryer and lamp. The hair dryer arrived as did a bulb. We let her try the bulb but she agreed it was the lamp that was not working. She said they would ask the maintenance person to look in. We went out to a concert and the lamp had been replaced whilst we were out. Next morning we went to have breakfast and were told we could only have the continental breakfast and if we wanted cheese or meat we would have to request it. On the menu it stated that the continental breakfast is Â£14.95 and the full English Â£19.95. The website would have you believe otherwise. We went out after breakfast and didn't return until mid afternoon to change and prepare for our evening out. It was a huge surprise to us to walk in and find the bed still unmade, towels not changed and tea/coffee etc not replenished. By this time I was so irritated I forced myself to take a long bath and not get into a dispute with the reception staff. At 16.15 there was a knock on the door and as my husband was in the shower I answered it wearing only my bath towel. It was the maid who had come to clean the room !!! At a quarter past FOUR in the afternoon !!! I said it was not a good time and she left. We never saw her again. The room had cost Â£384 for two nights and whilst the staff (all female) were pleasant, they seemed slow to respond. Nice decor yes but we have had much better service and value for money at Premiere Lodge and B&B's costing half as much.

Reviews.Title: “The Review Said Just Re-Opened after Total Refit - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 0lympus
Reviews.Content: The review we read of this hotel said that it had just been re-opened after being closed for 2 years for a total refit....Mmmmmm? We were in the 'Mews' rooms....for Mews read basement. The room was small, made even more so by the fact that, for some reason, we had they had left a 'Z' bed at the foot of our bed, which made it extremely difficult to walk around the room. The carpet was stained and the furniture was a little battered, which was surprising if the hotel had only just re-opened, but the room and the bathroom were clean. The room was very warm, but airconditioning was noisy, so had to be turned off overnight. We had no traffic noise. The bathroom was large, much longer than the room, with a walk in shower at one end.........but the towels were on a rail right at the far end...no rail near the shower, ditto the wash basin...no towel rail!! The bath was enormous and I was really looking forward to filling it up and having a long soak........no plug and no one available to find one on a Saturday afternoon. Again, newly renovated??? The paint and plaster were coming off of the wall in some places. There was only one tiny extractor in this big bathroom..... which was placed next to the fire alarm. The alarm was set off by the steam as my husband took a shower, which resulted in someone rushing into our room unannounced. There was tea and coffee making facilities, but minimal supplies and no milk although some was brought to the room quickly when we queried this. We did over sleep in the morning and had missed the breakfast times, but we went in anyway and asked if we could just get some coffee, which they were happy to make. The croissants etc for the continental breakfasts were still laid out, so we helped ourselves. Overall, we were a little disappointed. From the reviews we thought that this hotel would be brand, spanking new, but it wasn't. However, it was clean, the staff were very friendly and the location was spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Tea for two”
Reviews.Author: smith226
Reviews.Content: Staff are very attentive, polite and welcoming. priced at Â£64 for two persons the tea would have been seriously overpriced without the voucher that i booked with at Â£19. The tea is average, with disappointing processed cheese and ham sandwiches, thin fillings in the salmon and cream cheese and likewise in the cucumber sandwiches. For the Â£64 i would be looking for thick british cut ham and bread at least. Scones ... ok (could do with more jam and clotted cream). I was happy to pay Â£19 because frankly you pay for what you get. We both enjoyed the tea but this is not 4* . If you are looking for a special treat...there are better places in london

Reviews.Title: “2 well deserved ladies for an afternoon tea at tophams hotel”
Reviews.Author: AwfulC1
Reviews.Content: We didnt stay at the hotel, we just went for the afternoon tea yesterday. I had got a voucher which was worth Â£19 for two people, which was worth every penny. The original price for the afternoon tea at the hotel was Â£22.50 per person. As we had so much food and drink I would have gladly paid the Â£22.50. The food was very fresh and lovely cakes, couldnt get enough of them. We had at least 3 pots of tea and a glass of wine included in the price and not forgetting the coffee and different types of tea if you wanted. The staff were very nice, friendly and very polite, they always came up to us and asked us if we wanted more tea, coffee, sandwiches etc. Anyone who would like to treat someone special for an afternoon tea I would definately recommend this hotel. Last year I went to Kensington palace for an afternoon tea it was no where near as nice as this place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely tea for two”
Reviews.Author: juliamcg_11
Reviews.Content: My friend and I visited the Tophams Hotel for afternoon tea yesterday and could not have been more delighted with the service and food. The waitress was very attentive and we enjoyed a glass of sparkling rose while we waited for our food. The sandwiches, scones and cakes were fresh and plentiful and the atmosphere very relaxing.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “In a word...Awful.”
Reviews.Author: Andyt4x4
Reviews.Content: I'm staying in London on business and I found this hotel on laterooms.com. The pictures look nice and seemed good value for money. On arrival after performing all the normal checkin formalities they told me they were overbooked. A familiar theme I have found after reading a few reviews on here. They offered me a room in the mews hotel next door. It's dingy, dark and horrid. After going back and complaining that I would like some money back for having a lesser room I was told 'what do you want me to do about it?'. Her attitude just stank. Eventually I got 15% back off the price I paid. If I had the energy I would have complained some more. It will do for one night but only just. It's a shame this hotel didn't meet my expectations. Its close to where I'm working and would have been a conveinent choice for the next few months I'm here.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean centrally located boutique property”
Reviews.Author: TheCaliTraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located by Victoria station. It's a cute little boutique property which is a nice change of scenery from some of the big branded hotels i've stayed at in london. The rooms are small but well decorated in a comtemporary sleek fashion. There is free wifi, coffee/tea and nice flat screen TVs. The staff were all very friendly but it's sometimes intimidating to walk in the cozy lobby and have 3-4 of them greet you at once. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking in this part of town!

Reviews.Title: “AFTERNOON TEA”
Reviews.Author: sheila h
Reviews.Content: I booked afternoon tea here for my friend & I and read the reviews after I had booked it and was feeling sorry that I had booked it. Well I must say I came away from the hotel thinking that I must have been to a different Tophams to the one that I had read the reviews for.We were greeted by a lovely friendly staff. We were shown to our table in a very welcoming dining room and a member of staff came over to us with a glass of sparkling rose wine very nice. The finger sandwiches were very fresh and we were offered more when we had finished (very nice as we were hungry) I do not eat strawberry jam and was offered raspberry jam to have with the scones along with more cream. We could not eat all of our lovely cakes( too many sarnies) so was asked if we would like to take them home they came back to us in a box with more cakes in the box (we only left 2) very nice. Well done Tophams I hope to return in December with my Mother.

Reviews.Title: “The most expensive awful tea in the uk”
Reviews.Author: cyndot
Reviews.Content: We recently visited the Topham Hotel in Belgravia on a"special deal". afternoom tea with champagne for 2 for Â£28. The hotel is in a rather seedy part of Belgravia and looks a bit like a run down bed and breakfast. On arrival we were directed to the very small cafeteria like Dining Room. It was very noisy as the accoustics were poor, there was a party of about 12 women on the next table competing with a heavy rock music music track.All the guests appeared to be on special deals. We were handed a grubby tea stained menu which informed us that afternon tea with champagne was normally Â£67-00 per person ! We were served by a very young and nervous looking waitress with a pot of tea with 2 tea bags and a chipped milk jug and some sugar sachets, followed by a 3 tier stand with 9 small sandwiches, 6 minute shop bought cakes and two doughy scones with just enough jam and cream for one. We had to ask for our champagne, a clean milk jug and some more cream and jam. We ate as quickly as possible and left, visiting the one disgracefully dirty toilet on the way out. Never again !

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: AMcK2011
Reviews.Content: Booked room at Tophams Hotel through hotels.com. Paid in full on non-refundable rate. Arrived at hotel to find room was unavailable. Stored luggage and went for meeting. Upon return was shown to my room, out of Tophams hotel, down the street to the Belgravia Mews Hotel (see tripadvisor review for a laugh). Was shown into ground floor room facing the street, the room smelt awful, of damp and old cigarettes. Refused the room immediately. Spoke to manager at Tophams and threatened legal action and a report to westminster trading standards before got put into a "Tophams Room" which was, of course, what I had booked and paid for. It seems that Tophams try and offload unsuspecting visitors into the Belgravia Mews hotel. Frankly I think this is shocking and I have decided to make a formal complaint to both English Tourism and Westminster Trading Standards for misrepresentation. Avoid this hotel under any circumstances!!!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location, terrible check-in experience”
Reviews.Author: Shirley A
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel via hotwire.com, so we only learned its name and details after payment. the hotel is in a great location - very close to victoria station and about 10 minutes walk to buckingham palace, plus it looks great in the website, so we were very pleased with our deal, until check-in, that is. when we arrived we were told that the hotel was overbooked and that there are no double rooms available, only rooms with twin beds. this may have been acceptable except we specifically called the hotel right after booking it and reserved a room with a double bed and even spoke on the phone with the same receptionist who checked us in!! of course our call was not recorded along with our reservation so we were offered a room "next door" only for one night, and in return we would get a complimentary breakfast the following morning, plus an upgrade to a deluxe room for the rest of our stay. we initially accepted and a staff member took us outside to the adjacent building, which later we learned was an entirely different hotel. the room we were given was terrible! no light except for 2 bed lamps, one of which didn't even work! the toilet and shower were so tiny you literally couldn't take a single step inside! for 240$ a night, this was definitely not what we paid for! we returned to the front desk and were offered a better room, still "next door" but in the 4th floor, with no elevator. we didn't even bother to look at it and politely asked for our money back as this was not what we paid for. only then did the receptionist offer us a room in the hotel itself, the room didn't have a lot of space to move around in, but it was modern, with a double bed (weren't they overbooked 5 minutes ago?!?) and we were in a hurry to get to the theatre so we took it. the next morning we had learned that the a/c was not working and, being in the -1 floor, you could hear every step anyone takes on the wood stairs. we asked to switch rooms again. this time the receptionist (not the same one) was eager to help and offered us a bigger room on the ground floor, in which we stayed for the rest of our trip. that final room was an excellent one - bed was comfortable, a lot of space to move around in the room, flat screen TV and a bath tub, if we had gotten that one to begin with our review would've rated this hotel 5/5. in conclusion - nice hotel in a great location, just don't accept any rooms outside the main building.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: pinkgreen_diamomd
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nights at this hotel the end of June...after a long day arriving at 10.30pm i waited in the reception area (which is lovely!!) for 15mins while one of the receptionists "prettied up" one of the old awful rooms in the old part of the hotel...i was taken out of the new part of the hotel down the road to the old part of the hotel that hasnt been renovated at all....big mistake!!...it was smelly with rotten carpets..chipped dirty paint work everywhere...and the room was awful.I walked straight out back to the reception and asked for what id actually booked a fully renovated double/twin room with ensuite... the receptionist looked blank and shook her head...and offered me a room without ensuite..and another room for my daughter...without ensuite but with a bathroom way down the corrider passed many other rooms which they said nobody else would be using(as you will see from other reveiws other people use the bathroom too!!)..although both rooms were okish as in clean but tiny..i had come to London to spend time with my daughter...and had paid for a room with an ensuite..i requested my money back several times and was told she couldnt do anything until the morning...i refused to stay at the hotel and was offered no help to find a different hotel...its honestly a shambles...after months of emails and slow correspondence i have received NO refund and NO apology or even an offer of an upgraded!! ensuite room for any of my many trips to London i booked through Lastminute.com..who also werent as helpful as id expected although did give me 20% refund as i am a frequent customer!!.. total shambles ...i suggest you avoid at all costs!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: P59AL61
Reviews.Content: Having been allocated this hotel as a 'mystery hotel' we were very nervous having read the negative reviews by other contributors. However, our experience was nothing like the horror stories of damp, smelly rooms other people have reported. Having said that, the room was small and very overheated. We arrived in London at 10.30 a.m. and had contacted the hotel to see if we could check in early. This was not problem, although obviously the room was not ready. Luckily, we called back to the hotel in the afternoon prior to an evening at the theatre. The air conditioning was set to 30 degrees - it was a warm day with no need for a coat. Had we not returned and lowered the temperature, the room would have been very difficult to sleep in. There were one or two unacceptable issues with the room (considering this is a 4 star hotel) and we wouldn't stay again. The bed wasn't very comfortable and there was a lot of mould on the shower door seals. Certainly not worth the full nightly tariff. Choosing a mystery hotel was a first for us. Probably wouldn't have done it if we had been staying for more than one night and not sure we'd do it again having been almost dreading our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon tea”
Reviews.Author: VIM48
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had afternoon tea at Tophams Hotel this afternoon. We were a bit concerned having read the review on this site but were pleasantly surprised. We have had afternoon tea many times before in such venues as the Ritz and the Savoy and there was nothing wrong with this one. We were welcomed warmly at the door and showed into a small but attractive dining room. The sandwiches and scones were fresh, there was plenty of cream and jam and the little cakes were very nice. The sparking rose was lovely and the whole experience was enjoyable. The only thing I would have liked would have been the offer of a second pot of team but not a deal breaker.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: paula4168
Reviews.Content: Little small but for 1 person it was perfectly fine. 5 minute walk to victoria station, the original tour bus stop is right around the corner and several attractions are within walking distance including 2 theatres. I felt it was a safe location, had no problems walking around alone during the day or at night..

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS!”
Reviews.Author: MC_W408
Reviews.Content: I share the view of others, this is a really poor hotel. Checked-in and taken down the street to the 'other' building. Basically this looks like an old B&B, poor quality, dark, no lift, and nothing like the description of the hotel as a newly refurbished 4* (you wouldnâ€™t pay more that Â£50 to stay in this sort of room/building). Refused room and given one in the main building. Had booked a twin, they provided a small room, queen bed, and offered to play a camp bed in the room. Was late for a concert, so just agreed. Camp bed was old, smelly, no sheet provided for the blanket, had to call for one when we returned. Room would have been acceptable for 1 person, certainly not 2, and definitely not a camp bed. Whilst everything looked newish, you can see that it was done on the cheap and there was a lot of wear already. AC was useless, shower was outside of the bathroom (odd) and the main door rattled each time someone on the same floor opened/closed their door. Hardly managed any sleep, mix of the camp bed (whilst collapsed in the middle of the night, and the noise from the corridor). Paid Â£125 room only, totally overpriced, please avoid, even a Travelodge would be better, and cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as expected but definitely not 4*”
Reviews.Author: Merce70
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel via Last Minute.com Top Secret Hotels and after reading the reviews on here and the fact that the hotel would require a Â£50 deposit (not mentioned when booking, only discovered that on Trip Advisor) I attempted to cancel it but with no luck. I stayed for 2 nights last week. The reception area is lovely but when I checked in I was told they couldn't accept my Maestro card (I had already checked prior to the stay that they would accept the Maestro card.....) and then had to go back to the nearest ATM at Victoria Station to take out money so I could pay the deposit in cash. Upon leaving to do this the door handle came off in my hand, comedy moment but not a great start.... After checking in I was pleasantly surprised by the room - although small the decor was modern and the bathroom was a good size. I was a bit taken aback by the small but steep flight of stairs that you had to descend to get down to the wardrobe and bathroom. It proved no problem to me but if you have mobility problems (or just don't want to be trailing down a flight of stairs in the middle of the night to visit the bathroom !) then you might want to request a room where the en suite is on the same level as the room. I would advise anyone travelling who perhaps fancies a drink in the hotel bar that they don't serve alcohol. I was going to have a quiet glass of wine and was advised by the staff that there is no alcohol served there and I would have to go to the nearest bar, needless to say I didn't bother. On the whole the decor and vibe of the hotel is nice and the location near to Victoria and Belgravia is certainly handy and a pleasant area to stay in. However, I would say that this is definitely not a 4* hotel - it has obviously been given a lick of paint and a cosmetic upgrade in the past few years and although that's ok I did notice a lot of issues (stained blind in bathroom, warm mini-fridge, comedy door handle on front of hotel....) that they still need to sort out. Having said that I will probably spend Â£50 less and just book a Travelodge in the city centre in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: Lauren B
Reviews.Content: Booked through hotels.com. Good rate. Clean, bright, quiet room. Only problems are (1) TV faces wall instead of bed, so you can't watch TV from bed, you have to sit in uncomfortable chair to watch TV, and (2) water pressure is poor, and shower vacillates repeatedly between hot and cold. Beware expensive breakfast if not included in room rate. However staff very accommodating about printing documents for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All”
Reviews.Author: Wales C
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a secret hotel through lastminute.com. Booked two rooms, advertised as 4 star in Belgravia. Surprised when we booked that our two single room were not on-suite. But the hotel is very nice and rooms are very clean and modern. They did give us a free bottle of sparkling wine to say sorry about the on-suite issue. The staff and management are trying very hard and breakfast was nice - I think some of these reviews are old and out of date. The area is very posh and a nice place to wonder around at night . Just make sure your room has a bathroom and you should be ok !

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel and service I have EVER experienced”
Reviews.Author: fl0wers
Reviews.Content: My friend booked this hotel for a one night stay as it looked lovely online and was close to Victoria station where we needed to be early the next day. On arrival, late in the evening, we approached the hotel. From the outside it looks nice and reception area is lovely however, this is the only good thing I could say about this place. We checked in and were taken outside the hotel again, along the road and into another building. We were taken up about 4 flights of stairs (carrying our own heavy bags) and as we got higher up we realised that this was nothing like what we had booked. The wall paper was peeling off the ceiling and you could see damp coming through the walls. The carpets were badly stained with what looked like paint. The receptionist took us firstly to the wrong room and so we were up and down the narrow stairs lke a yo-yo (with our bags in tow)!! When we eventually got to our room, it was horrible!!! My friend immediately complained and said that we would not be staying here as it was not what we had booked from the website. They eventually took us and our bags back to reception where we were met with the manager on duty. I say manager but she was no where near a manager. We explained the situation and she said that unfotunately the hotel was fully booked and there was nothing she could do. An absolute disgrace that they had overbooked the hotel and had basically thrown us into a dump next door. She did eventually offer us a room at their sister hotel in Knightsbridge for the night but on looking this up on the i-phone it had even worse reviews than Tophams ad we refused to go there. We asked for a refund and thought we could book somewhere else but she said she could not give us a refund as we had booked through trip advisor. She had a huge attitude problem and was extremely rude when it was the hotel that were in the wrong. She kept saying that she did not have authority to make decisions - well, why was she the manager on duty then?? My friend and I decided to leave and booked a hotel elsewhere at extra cost to ourselves. That might sound extreme but if you had seen the room you wouldn't have been staying there either...like a scene from a horror movie!!! Disgusting hotel and poor service!! Would NEVER return!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, not at all what the photos on the website showed it to be.”
Reviews.Author: lmerc
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room well in advance. I arrived and was taken to a tiny room with a huge crack down the wall measuring maybe 12 ft square without the furnishings and finish as seen on the hotel website.The shower room and toilet is separate and shared. When I booked I was told this would cost Â£344 for wed and thurs. I am here now and have to stay as I can't find any rooms elsewhere. The customer care is very lacking. I can't speak with the manager as he left and is not reachable apparently. I have been told I will have a better room tomorrow. Wholly unacceptable. Ironic that the course I attended today covered how to deal with patient complaints. If you're thinking of booking please don't.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I thought”
Reviews.Author: Cp40_11
Reviews.Content: Arrived @ hotel around 15.30 it was busy @ the reception some customer kicking off!! Got checked in we had a nice room, though after reading they have had a major revamp the attention to detail was lacking, ie no light bulb in bedside lamp water stain down the wall from a leak! no toilet roll holder. It states that fully stocked mini bar but only couple of soft drinks & bar of chocolate. The bed was extremely soft, but adequate. Breakfast was ok we just had the continental. We found the staff very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY not that bad... But were we just lucky?”
Reviews.Author: katiet83
Reviews.Content: I won a stay at Tophams, with theatre tickets from my company. Myself and my partner had been reading these awful reviews and cringing for weeks, quite frankly I was dreading it and preparing for the worst... Thankfully I was pleasantly surprised. Upon arrival we found the staff to be courteous and welcoming even though we checked in hours before 2pm check in, our room was ready. I was disappointed I had to pay Â£50 deposit, partly because my mantra in London is 'spend spend spend'- what if I ran out of cash? Anyway we were given room 104, this must have been one of the better 'website photo' rooms- very nice and faultlessly clean. Decor was neutral but well thought out(Tk Maxx) Unfortunately the shower didn't work and we only had 3 tv channels but I like a bath and who needs tv in London? Breakfast area is very nice, cosy but I'm shall we say 'rotund' and didn't have a problem moving past tables. To be fair I would have been disappointed had I paid for 'full breakfast' as the ingredients were a little bland, My partner didn't enjoy the 'joke shop' bacon. Luckily I'm vegetarian. Still the breakfast hearty enough to set us up for day. Tophams is ideally located near numerous theatres and even though minutes away from Victoria, very quiet in the upmarket, Belgravia area. Overall we had a pleasant stay and we would book again (if there was an offer on). I will add though as we were leaving, 2 German gentlemen were checking in and were being given the old' we're overbooked, but we have this place not far away...' Chestnut- so as previous review says is it worth risking again? I would recommend The Thomas Cubitt on Elizabeth street, a few minutes away too. Lovely cocktails and good bar food, as long as you don't mind small portions!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: aberboy1991
Reviews.Content: Young man on the door was very helpful in taking our luggage to our rooms and opening the door for us every time we wanted to access or leave the hotel. Very convenient, close to station and to all the theaters. We had dinner and breakfast at the hotel, both were enjoyable. A selection of DVD's were available to us to view for free and there was a small passage where I could enjoy a read of the papers and use the internet. Room was comfortable and clean although there was an odor of stale air on arrival but cleared after opening the windows. Room was a bit small, with the en-suite door opening against the bed. Room was lacking natural light. In all a very enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad-don't worry if you have booked here!”
Reviews.Author: RobinManchester
Reviews.Content: To be honest after reading lots of bad reviews on trip advisor I really was very nervous about staying here! My friend had booked via late rooms but had booked a non-refundable room so when we read the reviews and wanted to swap hotels we were told there was no way this would be possible. Great! A bit of a worry considering I'm almost 6 months pregnant and we were reading all kinds of things about no en-suite rooms, camp beds and alternative hotels which sounded awful. So, my friend decided to call the hotel repeatedly checking the room we booked was available as booked with en-suite etc. This seemed to have worked because when we arrived for the bank holiday weekend, checking in at 4pm on the Saturday, everything was fine! Phew! The lift is a bit small but to be honest we were only on the first floor so we decided to walk to our room as often as possible since the lift seemed to take ages. When we got up to our room everything was fine. We checked the toilet flush, shower, tv etc. The only thing I couldn't find was a fire safety sheet which should have been placed on the door. We eventually found it in the wardrobe and it was very basic to say the least, not sure what a fire safety officer would make of it, but there you go! So, the room was fine, yes it's definitely NOT a 4* and nor should it ever be listed as one but it was absolutely fine and the beds were comfy, the air con worked fine as long as you had it on during the day and it was switched off at night, and despite being at the front of the hotel it was very quiet and a convenient location. I would agree with some comments about the breakfast though. Not great but it depends what you want. The most basic of choices and judging by the ocado van we saw parked outside on the Sunday morning, that's obviously where they get their food from!! But, all I wanted was a bowl of cereal and some toast and there was plenty of that. Infact you had to cook the toast yourself which I quite liked because it meant I could toast it as much or as little as I wanted. I do appreciate what people say about the room being small and not being able to move chairs though. Fortunately, the breakfast room really wasn't very busy when we went in so we could sit anywhere we wanted. I kept wondering if there were less people staying there than usual for a bank holiday due to some of the reviews on here which is a shame because it's not a bad hotel from my experience. I didn't appreciate the fact we has to sign for what we were eating before we had eaten anything, they could have just noted what we were eating and added it to the bill at check out and I do think it's a little bit mean to state breakfast on the booking, when what they mean is 'continental' and nothing else. In fact, you have to pay extra for a bowl of fruit and any yoghurts, (not that I could see any yoghurts anyway!!) So, all in all the hotel was fine. I can't comment on the Â£2 charge that somebody else mentioned but I will get my friend to check her statement next month since they took a pre-authorisation amount of Â£100 from her credit card, but they did give a receipt to prove that's what they had taken. The staff were friendly and helpful and kept our bags for us whilst we dud some more exploring of London on the Monday. Would I stay here again? Based on my own experience yes, probably. However, there's just too many bad reviews to run the risk again, which is a shame, because if we hadn't read thes beforehand I certainly wouldn't have felt as worried nor the need to book other hotels just in case this one was as bad as some of the reviews state!!

Reviews.Title: “An unpleasant hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: Drucherry
Reviews.Content: This was booked through lastminute website for our wedding anniversary. We paid online in advance, but on arrival the staff demanded a credit card to take fifty pounds deposit from us, reportedly because they had several folk leave without paying. I declined to give our information over as we had already paid and were not intending to have anything from the bar etc as we had just been on the Orient Express and were going out to meet friends. Despite this and my protestation that I did not have credit card or any inclination to be penalised for other customers misdemeanours, my husband relented and provided his financial detials which I felt was a mistake. He was not provided with a receipt against my better judgement and on leaving we were simply waved out by a different lady. As predicted a Â£2 charge appeared on his statement some days later which could not be explained by the hotel when we enquired. I appreciate this is not much but if they do this to every customer it surely adds up every week. ''Breakfast'' was advertised on their website and lastminutes, but on arrival we were only allowed continental. Dining room was so ridiculously over cramped, no one could move their chairs in or out from table at all. Laughable.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Starburst123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night and were more than a little afraid, judging by the reviews we had read. We were dealt with very swiftly by reception and all the staff were very friendly. We arrived earlier than check in but they made sure our room was cleaned ASAP and we were fine. However, we heard the receptionist on the telephone to another hotel discussing what to do with the "over booked guests" and that they had "minus three" to deal with. As we left reception, she was discussing with a colleague that it was going to be a "bloody tough day". The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. Could have easily slept in it all day! The decor was nice and very modern. The room was slightly small but we expected that from the "boutique" aspect. Basic finishings were required however-television didn't work properly; toilet flush was broken; shower leaked; cracks in wall etc but none of this ruined our stay. Our view from the window was appalling - a few pipes and a brick wall, but we were only in the room at night so didn't bother us too much. Breakfast was bar far the most disappointing aspect. We were charged Â£14.95 for a full English (I think it was Â£12.95 for continental) which we had to get ourselves. We found it highly shocking that it was self service for such a high price. The food was cold and they were low on pretty much everything. No orange juice and no hash browns - despite stating them on the menu. We asked the staff if they were available and were simply told "no". An apology wouldn't have hurt. The location was perfect. Five minutes from Victoria Station and within walking distance (10 minutes) from the London Eye, Buckingham Palace etc. All in all, we had a nice stay but it was not worth the money charged and any one considering staying here should be under no illusions that this is a 4* hotel. It is a 3* hotel with fancy wallpaper.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Ebury Street”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: First two rooms I was given were grubby and didn't look like they had been properly cleaned since the previous guests had escaped. Finally given another room on the top floor (no lift). Had to get my key changed as it didn't open the outside door (my room was in the building beside the one that reception was located in). The whole experience was summed up perfectly by another couple of guests who, when finding me stuck outside trying to get in, told me not to worry and that I shouldn't be in too much of a rush to get in as I'd only want to leave once I'd seen the state of the place! My advice is... don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “A comboy operation..”
Reviews.Author: Karin N
Reviews.Content: The hotel is promoted as a newly renovated luxary hotel. At a first look this seems to be the case but a closer look reveals a cowboy operation. The hotel is clearly lacking some finishing touches.. At arrival the cleaning lady was still in the room, when finally left alone it only took 10 minutes before another member of staff entered the room, without knocking. We then wanted to lock the door but found that the lock did not work. Other things that did not function was the fridge and the remote control. During the night you can choose to leave the extremly loud air con on or switch it off and sweat it out. Now, time for breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: paul_terry18
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at the Tophams in London England on Ebury Street. The staff at the front desk were all very proffessional, polite and accommodating. My room was very nice, extremely clean and quiet. The housekeeping staff were very efficient cleaning the room each day. The staff in the restaurant were excellent! The breakfast was delicious and the staff were willing to accommodate any special requests ( extra coffee, tea etc) I will definitely stay at the Tophams hotel on my next trip to the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Staff with a bad attitude and far from impressed”
Reviews.Author: suzanna c
Reviews.Content: Booking 2010 - The Goring was fully booked with many other family members and so I booked The Topham Hotel (in our own name and credit card), a twin room for 3 nights for my employers sister - (a VIP) and her daughter who were in London for a large family wedding, who wanted to be close to her immediate family who live in Belgravia. Tophams Hotel were aware of our name and the guests names. I went in advance to book in person and received an excellent and attentive service from the very sweet receptionist and was assured that our specific requirements would be met, the guests were expected on an early morning flight from USA. The receptionist was very helpful and kindly informed us to telephone on the morning in question and that if no guests were in the room, our guests would be welcome to check in at 8am, or if any previous occupants vacated early, they would get the room ready first so that our guests could check in before 2pm, at the very least we could check in their luggage as early as possible. On the day, I telephoned early on the morning to be informed that the previous occupants had checked out but they would not get the room ready any earlier than 2pm. We rang later and were informed that the room was ready for check in and we went on ahead with the luggage (to unpack and prepare their personal items). We were met with a disgruntled guest arguing with the receptionist! (not the one who had made our booking). We then had to wait an eternity whist another guest was checked in at snails pace! The foreign and unprofessional receptionist with an attitude problem, refused to let us have access to the room to leave the luggage or even to give us the keys. We very calmly and patiently explained the situation (several times) and this made her even more resolute and demanded that the staying guests HAD to check in themselves and give their own C/C details, we were informed that she would not deal with us (even though the booking was in my name, fully paid and they had my C/C details AND I HAD ALL PAPERWORK WITH ME!!! . It could have been a scene from Fawlty Towers! In between all of this a friend of hers came in to chat, a black guy wearing a baseball cap and hoodie and upon seeing my face she told him she would speak to him later and he left. By now (approx 15 minutes later) my patience had deserted me and I very forcefully told her to bring the manager to sort this out immediately before I lost my temper - I was told the manager was off sick! I had to tell her to get me someone who had at least minimum intelliegence and common sense and told her there was going to be a lot of trouble if we did not get into the room RIGHT NOW! She went off and returned with someone else who asked us to take the luggage to the dining room, thinking that someone was going to take it up to the room we did so and returned to reception to be told that we could leave the luggage there until our guests checked in (in a public unsecured area)! I retrieved the luggage which was in the process of being moved to the kichen by a kitchen employee?? I told them it was well after check in time and demanded the keys immediately and asked for someone to bring the luggage to the room (suprise - there was no one available)! The girl was told by another employee to take us to the room - we were met outside the room by cleaning staff, heaps of used bedding and cleaning items AND THIS IS WELL AFTER CHECK IN TIME. Apart from a huge cobwed floating on the ceiling the room looked small but okay, however, another problem was that it was a double room not a twin room and was told by the same receptionist that as it was mother and daughter that it should not be a problem for them to sleep together!!! I was told they were twin beds pushed together and that our guests could seperate them if they so wished. I told them the guests would be arriving very shortly and ordered THEM to seperate and prepare them without delay as per our booking and specific requirements. I also asked if the cleaners would be moving everything out of the hallway before they arrived and was assured they would. 15 minutes later we took the guests to the hotel and the receptionist again tried to demand their C/C details, eventually we go them to the room where we yet again were met with the cleaners, used laundry in the hall and cleaners just finishing off in their room. I did not have any further dealings with the hotel but am informed that it was not a good experience and our guests also did not even go down for breakfast there despite payment for breakfast appearing on our C/C statement! A great pity as this little hotel is in a good location (I live in the same street) and could be a hidden gem but alas not what it appears. Unprofessional, amateur and appears to be run by basic staff with no authoritive management. Ideal if you want a roof over your head and not too concerned about service or anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: just-1-tourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location very close to Victoria station. You can easily walk it, even with luggage. The hotel has a very pleasant atmosphere the staff (including Sarah) are welcoming and helpful. It has a very 'family' feel while still retaining professional standards. The rooms are small compared to north America but this is par for the course in London. The rooms are very clean and tasteful. The bathrooms though small have a tub as well as shower and are nicely finished. The hotel itself is a typical georgian town house that has been divided into rooms. It retains many original features, while having a very boutique feel. Other plus points free wifi. I have stayed twice now. Both twin rooms, unfortunately the second time there was not a 'twin' room available so it was a double bed plus 'camp' bed, which made things a little too cramped and not ideal for the adult in the camp bed! Nonetheless the hotel is a good location, the staff are lovely and it is clean. I will stay there again next time I visit London.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing but could have been worse [and don't worry it you have booked this place!]”
Reviews.Author: sportychick1977
Reviews.Content: I was booked into the Tophams by a company I was working for in Sloane Square and whilst the location is good for Victoria, the hotel itself was pretending to be something it can never be. I was a bit worried about staying here after reading other reviews, but the place was fine, just not as good as where I normally stay [One Aldwych] and certainly not a 4 star. Firstly the room i had on the ground floor was clean and had everything i needed [including air conditioning, on what happened to be a stinking hot day] The reasons it could have been worse; the room was tiny and i mean very small, so it was a good job I was travelling alone. It was supposed to be a double room but the bed was only a 4ft6 bed and there was definitely not enough room for two people. I would suggest booking a twin room and then pushing the beds together, or better still only stay here if you are travelling alone. The mattress also needed replacing but being alone i could sleep at an angle. The shower was good but there wasn't much room to get ready for the evening event i was attending. The room had a fridge which was a bonus and there were tea and coffee making facilities. The rest of the hotel is basically just like being in the front room of a house. In fact the whole hotel is just converted from what would have been a row of terrace houses. The reception area has not enough room and too many staff and the breakfast room was tiny with too many tables crammed in. At best this hotel could be an upmarket 3 star hotel but they advertise as a 4 star, charge 4 star prices and then a guest is disappointed. I heard guests at another table telling the waitress they had breakfast included in the rate, but she said yes only a continental breakfast. The guest argued the type of breakfast wasn't specified and the waitress agreed he was right but that when the hotel includes the breakfast it is only ever a continental, not a cooked. He asked how he was supposed to guess this fact and she just shrugged. The breakfast was hugely overpriced for the choices available. There were no wholegrain cereals and apart from toast, some very tired pastries and a bit of fruit. Another guest asked whether she could have her croissants warmed, but the waitress just said no! I informed the staff I only wanted a continental breakfast and within seconds of me sitting down to eat my cereal I had the bill shoved in front of my face. The waitress looked shocked when i told her i would deal with it when i had finished eating! I have travelled extensively and stayed in all sorts of places and there are so many B+B's that are better than this hotel could ever be, I think they need to remarket.
