I said absolutely not & that I needed to stay there as I had a conference close by & that was my whole reason for booking it. They eventually found us a room - to insult us by saying the rooms were flooded was a step too far for me. They clearly always overbook the hotel & try to move people to their sister hotel. Our room was extremely small but well furnished & comfortable with a decent sized bathroom with a nice shower. We didnt have breakfast or spend any time there apart from sleeping because I was so annoyed with what they had done. I would avoid this hotel as they are dishonest & there are plenty of better hotels that wont mess you around.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: hcten24
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews for this hotel we were very worried about staying here, but as it turned out there was no reason to worry. As soon as we got there the staff were very helpful and pleasant, the room was clean and comfortable what more do you need. Someone mention the tv not being brilliant, the picture wasn't great to be fair, we stayed in the first night we were there because i didn't feel well (nothing to do with the hotel) so we got a dvd from reception free of charge to watch (how many places can you do that). The location of the hotel is brilliant is an ideal base for a stay in London. We hadn't finished seeing everything that we wanted to see before we checked out and the staff were more than happy for us to leave our bags there (we left them there for most of the afternoon) so we didn't have to carry them around with us, they were as polite to us when we collected them as they had been when we checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mistifuldawn
Reviews.Content: At first appearance the hotel is clean and well presented, check-in was quick and painless, as I had been concerned over staying in the "sister hotel" after reaading reviews online. The room itself was small but clean, the only problem being the tv was not properly tuned in and so we only had two channels (bbc one and itv). We did not have the breakfast so cannot comment on that. The staff seemed friendly, although the manager/ supervisors less so. It was very quiet and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Window latch that didn't lock..pretty hotel but unsafe”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1187069
Reviews.Content: On first appearances this hotel is nice, clean and pretty. My only problem was that the window in the bedroom, a huge sash window, did not lock and could be opened easily by someone on the outside, especially as there was a flat roof outside the window. I told reception and said how worrying and dangerous this was. The receptionists did not care, and said it might get fixed in the morning. If I wasnt staying with a friend I would have asked to switch rooms. It sounds minor but it wouldnt be if a burgular had broken in, be aware!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I must have been lucky”
Reviews.Author: dr0pdead_g0rge0us
Reviews.Content: Having read the previous reviews I was panicking after last minute.com allocated this hotel as part of their "top secret" allocation. I still think it was overpriced (Â£120 superiour room )for what it was BUT I can't complain about the issues that other travellers had. I was ready for a "set down" with staff if I'd got a rubbish room. My only issue with the room was the air con was only blowing out hot air so we had to leave the window open to get cool air (not entirely comfortable on a ground floor room).

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: charmedforsure
Reviews.Content: I had the worst hotel experience of my life with this booking. When we went to check into Tophams hotel at midnight (our flight was late) the room we booked was unavailable. The lady offered us a room without a bathroom...we refused. She then told us that we could have a room 10 doors down in a "Sister Hotel". We asked to speak to a manager but she refused. After 30 minutes I agreed to look at the rooms she was offering. She said the room in that hotel without a bathroom had a bathroom right beside it that we could use...there was a bathroom down a stairs at the end of a corridor, I totally found this unacceptable. We saw the other room in the sister hotel, it was awful. It was more like a student flat and bared no resemblance to a 4 star hotel. We were very upset, I had a business meeting the next morning, was totally wrecked tired and just wanted to get a place to sleep. We demanded to speak to the manager and he eventually was called 1am and he agreed to give us a Â£35 refund (which never happened) if we accepted the room in the sister hotel. At this stage we were too exhausted to argue so we accepted. They also offered us a breakfast. So we went to the room and I had no idea what awful conditions were ahead of us: The phone was not working so we could not contact reception there was no top sheet on the bed the pillows were old and not nice *I can't say more than that* It was FREEZING and we could not work the storage heater in the room, it was broken There was no hot water The shower door was broken There was a recessed light in the shower unit and it was loose and coming down,completely dangerous. There was no milk to even make tea I had to get dressed at 8, walk down to reception in the rain and ask where I could get a shower and they told me I could use one in that hotel, I refused to carry my toiletries on the street in my dressing gown so they gave me a key to a room 3 floors up. I then started to cry...I have never had such a negative experience...it was upsetting beyond words and I had a very important business meeting that day and felt completely unprepared and upset.I never closed my eyes that night, had no sleep as it was so cold and just rotten. I booked this on Secret Hotels...beware people!

Reviews.Title: “warm & welcoming, rooms clean, staff friendly, whats the problem?”
Reviews.Author: Dooltravel
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 17:00 hrs on the Monday evening having already emailed to say we would arrrive as a party and would like to stay in this hotel, and not the sister hotel. Apaet from a hiccup in the lift (got stuck for 10 mins) absolutely everything was as you would expect from a 4* hotel. Rooms were clean, boutique style. I had two children with me and they accommodated us in two adjoining rooms whihc was great. I was extreemly worried about the reviews and quite prepared to ask for money back and warned all my party however we all found this a great hotel, and in the middle of all we needed to see. 5 minute walk from the palace with a great cheap breakfast 100 yards in the same road which had a wall covered with photos of numerous celebs all visiting. Didnt try the food and bar in the hotel but both looked inviting!

Reviews.Title: “Appalling level of service and totally unprofessional staff”
Reviews.Author: clairaki
Reviews.Content: This was a company booking, made and prepaid through laterooms.com on behalf of customers visiting our company from overseas. 3 rooms for sole occupancy had been confirmed and paid for and yet upon arrival at the hotel our customers were informed that the hotel had allowed other guests to extend their stay and therefore would only be able to allocate 1 double and one single room. Thankfully an employee had driven our customers to the hotel and was able to negotiate the rooms that we had booked. The attitude of the staff was poor and unapologetic and as a previous review stated the hotel "lacked the most basic level of service". I have contacted the hotel via email to request feedback on how this occured but as yet have heard absolutely nothing back from them. I would not recommend using this hotel - certainly not prepaying to secure a room as unfortunately the payment and confirmation does not actually secure any such thing.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PeterHMidWales
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of it's proximity to Tate Britain which we intended visiting. It's location is excellent, a few minutes walk from Victoria station but on a very quiet and attractive street. It has several attractive cafes and coffee shops nearby, and Victoria Place is minutes away. The staff on reception were friendly and attentive, and the room, which was close to Reception on the Ground Floor was small but very well decorated and had effective climate control. The bathroom was efficient, well laid out and of a complementary standard to the room. We did not use the restaurant as we had other arrangements, but it, also, is very attractive and the prices for an evening meal appeared reasonable. Staying in this hotel improved our London stay experience.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel CAN be good!”
Reviews.Author: NigelWalshe
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this to let folks know that it is possible to have an enjoyable, good-value stay in this hotel, despite the large number of bad reviews. At a "Secret Hotel" rate of Â£120 a night for a double from lastminute, the standard of the accommodation that we received - comfortable, clean room, compact without being cramped, with characterful decoration - represents very good value for this area, where I have paid Â£75+ for really squalid accomodation in other hotels nearby. We stayed in the main body of the hotel - there is clearly an issue about being transferred to the "sister hotel", so the thing to do could be to get reassurance in advance as to where you will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised - charming, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: GerryMulhern4
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as one of Lastminute.com's Top Secret Hotels. Following payment, I was informed that the hotel I had booked was Topham's. Having read the reviews on Tripadvisor, I had serious misgivings about staying in this hotel. I need not have worried. The hotel was brilliantly located - in a quiet street but within a stones throw of Victoria Station. The room was spotless, warm and exceedingly comfortable. Granted, the toilet seat was a little shaky and there were one or two water marks on the bathroom ceiling, but these were no more than minor blemishes. The Neutrogena toiletries were top drawer and the breakfast, though not cheap at Â£14.95, was excellent. Wifi was free thoughtout the hotel. Staff were efficient and friendly - not at all as described in other reviews. All in all, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “A very mixed experience!”
Reviews.Author: Destinystar123
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult review to write......as I had a very different experience from my colleagues I was with. We booked through Lastminute.com and paid Â£85 per room per night, booking at the hotel is currently Â£185 for a standard room. When we arrived the hotel reception looked nice but agree with everyone else who says the staff are scary and incompetent! The first worrying thing was that one guest was already complaining that the keys seemed to open every hotel room door and that they had had something stolen from their room. And other staff were refusing to take phone calls which sounded like complaints! The next problem....we booked 3 rooms but after one of us was given a key we were asked if we knew each other as they only had one room left but that it was a suite! Obviously we were annoyed but I was given the single room while the guys took the suite. Reception gave some hopeless excuse for not having a room and other guests arriving later were fobbed off by being told their payment hadnâ€™t got through and they were being move to a different hotel. What was offered as a suite turned out to be 2 bedrooms separated by stairs but with the bathroom inside one of the bedrooms, not exactly private! My bedroom luckily was really nice, I was told Iâ€™d been given an upgrade as it was all they had left. I could pick up on small things, shower door was off the rollers, few light bulbs out, wine stains on carpet, but overall the room was lovely and well worth the Â£85! Breakfast was like a comedy show, Â£15 for toast that burns on one side and bread on the other, and cooked breakfast didnâ€™t arrive until 90 minutes into breakfast. One angry guest (understandably so) had been told breakfast was on its way, waited nearly an hour, the chef finally turned up by which time he had already gone off and come back and all the cooked breakfast was gone! You were lucky if you got some! Meanwhile my colleagues were move to their own rooms, down in the basement where people have spoken about! They took me down just to show me....the rooms were horrific, Iâ€™m not normally someone to complain but they were so unhygienic I was horrified. The rooms stank of drains and damp, the carpet was so wet you had to walk around with shows on, there was no hot water and the wallpaper was peeling from the walls from the damp conditions. After complaining they were told they were the only rooms they had available. Neither of them managed to get much sleep at all. Personally I couldnâ€™t have stayed in that room for more than 2 minutes! They have now complained to lastminute.com who are looking to give a full refund but they should stop selling rooms at this hotel until it is sorted!! Oh and they don't serve alcohol in the bar! It also has a food menu in your room but we were told they don't serve food apart from breakfast! Even though there is a sign at reception to book dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Tried to check in but was informed I'd been moved to a 'sister' hotel, missing an important call and setting me up for a nasty s”
Reviews.Author: Fedupnblue
Reviews.Content: I've booked a room at your hotel tonight and arrived at 1950. I had to make an important call at 2000. Reception informed me that I'd been booked into your sister hotel in Belgravia - The Knightsbridge Green Hotel. I've just been checked in here into a room. The hotel is shabby, the room is awful and I've missed my call. I am extremely disappointed and will formalise my complaint. I am not used to this and I am very surprised you appear to feel that you might get away with treating guests like this.

Reviews.Title: “Is this the same hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Cambs81
Reviews.Content: Like ginger31 I was extremely surprised by the hotel - great location, nice and quiet street, very clean, comfortable and great value for money in London. Granted I did not pay anywhere near the prices quoted at reception, nor did I make the sombre walk down the road to the 'other' part of the hotel which seems to be the source of many of the bad reviews. I had 2 very good night sleeps and i couldn't fault the place or room - and believe me, i was ready to after reading the reviews here.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised after all the bad reviews here”
Reviews.Author: ginger31
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights in room 403 at the top of Topham's hotel. Lovely room - very clean, funky furnishings, and best of all, really quiet. I had booked this room through lastminute.com secret hotel sale and had panicked after I had read negative reviews online here, but could not fault this room. The convenient location - right beside Victoria tube statino - also helped! Breakfast was not included in my package so I cannot comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO THERE”
Reviews.Author: alex_horsley
Reviews.Content: You only have to look at the Trip advisor feedback to know that I cant tell you anything new. This place is absolutely appalling. Looks smart enough, but the staff are utterly clueless and unwilling to provide even the most basic level of service. I booked through Lastminute and they had given away my room, presumably to get more money, by the time I arrived (just before the time I stated I would arrive). Made no attempt to resolve the problem and stuck me in an awful fleapit B&B for the night. I returned the following night. Not bad looking room, though small and noisy, but the service has got to be experienced to be believed. Dont do it, and definitely dont use Lastminute to book it - they wont honour your booking if it doesnt suit them and neither they nor Lastminute are that bothered about refunding nights you didnt get.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here total rip off”
Reviews.Author: 777anon
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel in nov 10 Looked at Tripadvisor and took what it said with a pinch of salt ref doubling booking etc, however when I got there at 11pm at night ,they had doulble booked and we had to go to another sister hotel. Which was ok however they diodn't seem to care very much and really said take it or leave it. but the best is yet to come......I am still battling with them for a refund of my money which they took anyway even though i didn't stay there......You have been warned!!!!

Reviews.Title: “last minute.com secret rooms??? why are you keeping Tophams Hotel Belgravia London secret??”
Reviews.Author: Hamealdaeme
Reviews.Content: I jumped on trip advisor and looked up my secret hotel just booked - as it is rated 4 star and had a bar a restaurant - I was keen to see what my husband and I were getting for our anniversary. After reading the reviews I have asked for a refund as I do not want to go through any of this nonsense at the Tophams hotel - sounds like a racket!!! - I called the offshore call centre at last minute and was informed by 3 people I eventually spoke to I could not cancel my reservation and I had read the description incorrectly - the description states the hotel features a bar and restaraunt and is located just a short walk from Victoria. I was told this meant the bar and restaurant were located just a short walk from Victoria and were not in the hotel and not to expect a bar in the hotel itself. I am writing this just now and will follow up on my experience but if this hotel is not removed from last minutes site or the description changed I hope to take this further.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANTLY SURPRIZED AFTER THE REVIEWS WE READ”
Reviews.Author: parna2
Reviews.Content: we arrived with trepidation after reading the terrible reviews. The reception area was as expected for a town house hotel. The staff were friendly and attentive a massive shock after the reviews. Reception area was pleasant and rather funky . Our room was quite stylish although there were signs of wear and tear it was fine apart from the smell of smoke. The bathroom was a massive disappointment tiles off the walls and skirting grout missing fromt he floor and someone had stubbed a cigarette out in the bath ! The whole room stank of smoke which was a massive putoff. Allinall a much better stay than expected a great location but dont expect the bathroom to be in one piece !

Reviews.Title: “this place should be condemed”
Reviews.Author: edinburgh009
Reviews.Content: i was sold a 4 star and they try to show me a seperate building with rooms which are not even 2 star, fire alarms were ringing continually and the room i finally ended up with was a health and saftey liability. do not stay here under any circumstance

Reviews.Title: “Such a terrible experience - travelocity and lastminute should be ashamed!”
Reviews.Author: teresacrowd
Reviews.Content: I booked through Travelocity but Lastminute also sell rooms here as a Secret Hotel. The room cost Â£139. On arrival I was asked for Â£50 deposit despite the fact that I had paid up front and wouldn't buying any extras. Was shown to my room, 308, which had approx 2ft free space on two sides of the single bed. On the other sides, wall. There was no toilet, sink, bath or shower, Following a short discussion I was taken back to reception and the team searched for a better room. They did find me one, 309. However, I got confused when I went to the new room and went in the old one instead. Needless to say the key worked for both rooms. The room was newly decorated and the bed was okay. The bathroom was dirty and full of long dark hairs (nice), there were no hand or floor towels. However, pleased with my room, I settled down to watch the telly and lo and behold, the channels were not tuned in. The room with no loo suggests someone trying to rip me off. The telly, the key and the towels suggest an owner who has no experience of running a hotel. I dread to think what there fire procedures would be if they can't organise hotel basics. The way the staff were treated (can't say any more without risking this backfiring on the team) suggests a completely immoral operation. I have written to travelocity and am waiting for their response. I wont be using them until they take this hotel off their list.

Reviews.Title: “Scary Staff!!! Dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerKent_UK
Reviews.Content: First impressions were not good. Staff at the amature reception were very stern and very scary - not welcoming in the slightest. We were told we were going to be shown to our room but just pointed in the direction . The room was very small and very tatty. Nothing like what you see on the website. There were lumps of plaster peeling off the walls. The bed was so soft you were literally touching the floor. NO MOLTON BROWN just cheap toiletries on a chipped tray. Bathroom so tiny you can hardly breathe. No milk for tea and coffee. Breakast was completely cold. Our table was not even set properly. Only one other table occupied so no excuse. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping rough at Victoria Station might be a better option.”
Reviews.Author: Businessmotpleasure
Reviews.Content: Lying And thieving sums up my experience. The hotel doesn't do refunds and all complaints have to go through your "booking partner" which in my case was lastminute.com The hotel reception was pleasant. The staff obnoxious. Like many guests we were led down the street to another hotel. This hotel could be on a tv show that showcases cowboy builders - damp, dirty, broken bathroom fittings, no proper lights only lamps and a horrible smell. We got moved to 3 different rooms all of Which were well below the supposed 4 star rating. Many standard items that were sold to us on lastminute.com were missing such as a safe, aircon, mini bar etc etc even the phone in the room didn't work. Like other travelodge on this site we were also woken by staff entering the room at 3am. The young girl apologised in broken English but this along with the fire alarm at 5am completely ruined the already bad night we were having.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here at your peril”
Reviews.Author: cmsmyth
Reviews.Content: We had a number of problems at this hotel, but two were top of the list. First and formeost, the kitchen staff were simply unable to cope with the demands of breakfast. Supplies of bacon, sausages, baked beans and other elements of the great british breakfast were intermittent and on Sunday morning most guests were left short. I had no cooked breakfast at all, while my wife made do with a single rasher of bacon. Secondly, the televison did not work and when I reported this on our first of two nights I was assued it would be fixed the following day. This did not happen and by the time we left it was still not functioning. At checkout I listened to a litany of complaints from other guests, including one from a couple who had had to put up with a noxious smell of drains in their room during their stay. I am writing a formal letter of complaint to the hotel management who, incidentally, were completely unavailable to help their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value boutique hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes walk from Victoria but in an upmarket area in Belgravia with plenty of local cafes around for breakfast. Old style town building which is small but charming and well kept. Some rooms need a lick of paint as always in an old house but it was fresh and smelling of flowers. Nice bathroom which was spotless with modern good quality fittings. I read some of the bad reviews and obviously some people had genuine problems however I think some people don't make allowance for context. I have paid a lot more to stay in Paris hotels which were in awful locations with bad service and tiny box rooms. It's London afterall not Dubai!

Reviews.Title: “If this is 4* then a prison cell must be at least a 3*.”
Reviews.Author: jonathanbarnes
Reviews.Content: There is no way this is a 4* Hotel!!! The room was barely bigger than the bed within it, there was no coffe making facilities, the room was painted a grey-brown which was flaking in places, there was a small tv but with bad signal perhaps worst of all the bathroom was along a corridor down a set of stairs and open to all the other guests - and it was cold! To briefly summarise the disaster of my stay (which only lasted from 11pm on the 18th to around 8.30am on the 19th!) 1.Upon arrival I was not asked whether I wanted a wakeup call, morning paper, nor was I informed of the hotels facilities such as bar or breakfast arrangements. The staffs English was poor but they were polite. 2. Bedroom was shocking and the bathroom was not private, was cold and the shower took over 20 mins to warm up. 3. I visited the bar for a night cap, they did not stock spirits and spent 30 minutes looking for a bottle opener, in which time I decided to call it a night. 4.The cooked breakfast was not served until almost 8:30 at which point I had waited since 8 o clock. 5.Upon check out the card machine would not work (consequently I received my breakfast complimentary the least they could do!). Furthermore they did not have the courtesy to ask how my stay was!

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL AWFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MJR50
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable ! smell of raw sewage in the annexe rooms . staff are clueless. bar does not exist as they don't have anything to drink.I witnessed the staff being rude to other guests. very disorganised. the fire alarm going off at 7 in the morning didn't help but that could happen anywhere i guess. The rooms / bathrooms only just above hostel standards. if it was Â£50 a night it might just be acceptable. Having read some of the other reviews i would strongly question the author any review that says anything remotely positive about this hotel. MJR.NT

Reviews.Title: “Undersold by its Tripadvisor reputation”
Reviews.Author: 1CoMo1
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel, I then decided to check it out on Tripadvisor (yes, I know, the other way around might have been better), and I can only say I had a sleepless night before my arrival as a result of the contents of some of the previous reviews. Fortunately, when I did arrive, my expectations (which were admittedly very low) were dramatically exceeded. The hotel is small, is more 2-3 rather than 4 star, is bar-less and is lacking in some of the presence more normally associated with a hotel of the like espoused by its website. However, it also is clean (despite some reviewers), is very close to Victoria (as most reviewers acknowledge), is welcoming (again, contrary to some comments), and has toiletries(!) Some reviewers referred to the hotel suffering from poor maintenance and bad grouting in between tiles, for example. Although the tiling problem was evident in my bathroom (yes, I had a bathroom and a window, in contrast with some previous guests!) I believe many of the problems may have been caused by shoddy construction rather than anything more sinister. The hotel's website stated they had recently invested Â£6m in redevelopment, and I would think such a building could easily swallow significant portions of that money on structural and fire safety compliance alone. I would not go out of my way to recommend this hotel, however I would defend it against some of the very poor reviews it has received here before. If a small, clean hotel with compact rooms is what you're looking for; you will not go too far wrong though.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended if you want to ditch your partner / divorce your spouse”
Reviews.Author: TKMaxx_Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: This is a very weird hotel. Having stayed in over 100 hotels in London, this ranks most peculiar. If you're a single, male, business traveller, you're probably okay. The worst you will get is a feeling you've ventured into Twin Peaks territory, plus a bad night's sleep. You probably won't want to buy your PA a present for getting you a room here, but you probably won't die. Probably. If you're bringing you're partner here, by choice, then it's a shrewd move if you're aiming to quickly end your relationship. (And, vica versa, if your partner brings you here, assume they either don't use TripAdvisor, or have had enough of you.) My favourite bit was when I got woken up in the middle of the night by one of the receptionists banging on my door because they were looking for a spare bottle opener. Classic mental.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Topham's, not the Harcourt....”
Reviews.Author: Colourburn
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this website I was very tempted to cancel my reservation. We had booked this hotel through lastminute and felt a bit mislead as this is a secret hotel but magically the rating from tripadvisor is also secret. Lastminute of course are quick to shout about it when the hotels get a good review. Having said that however, this was more than anything a positive stay in a hotel that I was dreading... I would like to emphasise that, that it was generally good. My niggles below are minor ones, that the hotel could improve easily. We booked the King Deluxe room, which is in the main Topham's hotel. It was very nice, clean, spacious. However the receptionist did not deign to show us to our rooms however, merely gesturing in the general direction of the door and leaving us to our own devices. There was no room guide in the room, and it was very hot. Had to work out how to work everything myself. Hot water did not work in the shower, and when they fixed it, they fixed the cold water so it did not work... Just took a bath instead. Much nicer anyway. The breakfast is overpriced and offers poor food. All the money seems have been spent on the restaurant itself and not the food... The bread is supermarket sliced! The croissants are yesterday's at best. Juice not freshly squeezed. Wonder how old the other things are that I saw everyday. The eggs are beyond disgusting. For Â£15 per person, this is not funny. It would not be difficult to improve this however. As we were checking out, the receptionist tried to get us to pay for the 'complimentary minibar' offered in the list of hotel features. Showed her the email (from the Hotel itself) that said those magic words: 'complimentary minibar' and she said "oh, that's fine then". Ha. Staff on the whole are friendly, yet not very well trained. By this I mean that they don't seem particularly professional. The restaurant staff seem the best. I think that many of the reviews on this site reflect the Harcourt, and not the Topham's. I can understand people being upset! But for us it was pretty good. But we knew what they were going to try and we were having none of it.

Reviews.Title: “4 star? A hostel would be better.”
Reviews.Author: cos1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel is no more a 4 star hotel than a bench in Hyde Park! It seems that the original hotel, where reception is, may be ok, but I was brought down the street to a different building (what I deduce was previously the Harcourt Hotel). The only light was a lamp, the shower was tiny, the window wouldn't remain open, there was no housekeeping done, I had to go up to reception twice to get soap, the tea cup was dirty, there was (and the following all appear on their site as being included) no safe, no air conditioning, no minibar, no climate control, no safe box , no fridge, no hairdryer, it had a work desk with lamp (but no chair), no iron, no ironing board, no CD/DVD player, no radio, no complimentary mineral water, no bathrobe and there was no housekeeping done at all. I echo most of the reviews here, especially "Good hotel for mildew enthusiasts". If you have booked this hotel, try to ensure you get a room in the 'actual' hotel, it may not be much better, but it sure can't be any worse!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected based on other reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Megan277
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tophams Hotel for 2 nights on the 1st of January. It was a secret room on lastminute, and after reading the reviews on here we were obviously quite worried about what we would find upon arrival. As others have said, staff were a bit grumpy, and didn't seem all that interested in us. Once we were in the room, (Mews 2) we found it to be clean, welcoming, spacious and we absolutely loved the big bathroom which had a shower and a large bath. We saw no evidence of the damp that others have commented on, and no bad smells of any sort. We didn't use the dining facilities, so obviously can't comment on that. The only interaction we had with staff besides checking in/out was when we asked for a glass of ice water and this was given to us without hesitation! We had free internet as well, complimentary 24 hour access, which you just re connected to when the time was up, free still. All in all, we had a nice time at this hotel, but maybe you should try and book Mews 2 if you go!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Content: A poorly run hotel with unprofessional staff and terrible facilities. Good location, but that is little compensation for the wretched experience of staying there. The other reviews give a good impression of how awful this place is.

Reviews.Title: “MIGHT AS WELL SLEPT RUFF ON THE STREETS!”
Reviews.Author: gringo170629
Reviews.Content: Arrived 27/12/10 at "knightsbridge Green Hotel". Booked this hotel on off the internet. The pictures looked fantastic and location brillant. I walked through the front door to a reception that looked dated and makeshift. Reception staff were in Jeans and jumper, not what I would call a "4*" standard. On arrival the receptionist told me about the hotel had experienced technical difficulties...floods, electrical and lift problems. DON'T BUY THIS. Hotel overbooked! I think this is a regular occurrance. I actually felt sorry for the receptionist as she looked upset. She was a Actress and she should have been given an Oscar for best performance of conning customers! We got shipped off to the sister hotel "Topham hotel" belgravia. DON'T GO THERE EITHER! Hotel just as bad. Can't swing a cat in the tiny rooms and receptionist is an ICE MADEN. She couldn't be bothered and gave little eye contact and she was like a smiling assisan. Asked fo a bigger room. Stayed in the mews... very cold and smelt. (check out pictures)..All we wanted was a "refund" and to go somewhere else. I might as well asked for blood as they didn't want to budge. I asked to speak to the manager. He was on holiday... then walked in a man dressed in a suit with a super model with legs up to her armpits. Walked around like he owned the joint and demanding why the candles had not been lite. Manager and ice maden rowed infront of customers. Absolutely terrible. Both companies... late rooms and hotel didn't want to refund. It took a stand up row outside on the pavement at 2 am in the morning with the staff to get a refund. Holiday completey ruined. One word of advise.... stick to the established hotels....

Reviews.Title: “cute, great location, serious mechanical issues”
Reviews.Author: mervelicious
Reviews.Content: i stayed here twice; the first time, i was on the first floor and had a great experience. this time i was on the mews and it was horrendous. there was water seeping through the ceiling, under the glasses and down the miny bar, the shower didn't drain and flooded bathroom, the smoke alarm went off every time i showered and the toilet gurgled when i turned on the sink faucet. i couldn't take a bath because the lever to switch to the faucet didn't work. i told the front desk and they didn't even offer any assistance. it is affordable, it's in a great location, they have a couple nice touches serving apples and fresh pastry at reception and free wi-fi in the lounge and in the rooms -- so, if you dont stay in the mews and you're not looking for perfection, get down with your bad self and give it a whirl.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very poor unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: worldwidetourman
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in Tophams over a weekend with my girlfriend. Booked a double ensuite. Great location, very close to Victoria station, theatres, stop for London tour bus, Buckingham palace etc. Staff from arrival to departure were passive, clearly lacking in any kind of training in the service industry and had quite poor attitudes. There were several incidents that I witnessed with customers complaining to the staff at the front desk, and the attitude shown was atrocious. It seems toe that they need some serious talking to, otherwise people will vote with their feet and book else where. Tip: if breakfast is not included in your stay, AVOID the breakfast in Tophams, Â£15 EACH!!

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jinglesDevon
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room at the Tophams Hotel in Belgravia. The room was very small, no en-suite facilities and no coffee making facilities. On their website it didnt state that some of the rooms did not have these facilities. There was no alchohol served on the premises. I would not recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Probably not for you...”
Reviews.Author: PatAndMark
Reviews.Content: Tophams Hotel is clean, quite & close to Victoria Station (handy) but it's unorganized staff doesn't even replace supplies you run out of (ex: toilet paper). And it's not cheap. Also ... there was always some argument between staffers and guests or would-be guests at the front desk. We stayed 14 nights and heard about 5. Toward the end of my stay, I realized that if there was a fire in the old building, we'd never get out of there since we were at the end of a long, narrow hallway. Would go for larger, more modern, less "charming" hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews... I don't know why?”
Reviews.Author: TempletonPack
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in London for a couple of nights after my company asked me to stay at short notice. To be fair, on the night, there wasn't many options, but one that was available was the Tophams Hotel. First things first, the price was great, then onto the location, again, great, less than 5 minutes to Victoria and slightly more the other way towards Green Park. On arriving, the hotel has a lovely homely reception and a great, albeit relatively small lounge. You really do get the feeling of staying in a home away from home. Staff were efficient and friendly. The room I stayed in was sophisticated in style and decoration and had everything you needed in there. Bed was comfy, clean and welcoming. All in all, for the price of the hotel, I couldn't recommend it more.

Reviews.Title: “Unfreindly Staff, overpriced rooms, avoid "Mews" rooms smell of sewage!”
Reviews.Author: Chris_T39
Reviews.Content: Myself and three other colleagues booked this Hotel for a business trip on arrival the staff were very distant and unfreindly. My allocated room was in the "Mews" basically the basement. On entering the room there was a distinct and over powering smell of sewage. I complained and a new room was allocated but with no apology. If there is a problem with a room why book it out! The alternative rooms bathroom had a broken floor tile. When we booked the prices differed between us by Â£130 per night for identical room specs and no explanation as to cost variance. Would never recommend or book again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel all round”
Reviews.Author: APD54
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a really good place for my wife's birthday. I booked a King room at Tophams that was said to be spacious with a full bath etc. The room was really small and the bathroom only had a shower. The bedroom carpet was dorty and there was water running down the wall from upstairs. The reception staff were not at all helpful and refused to contact the manager for me. I wrote to complain and never even got a reply. I would never stay in this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jacqwal
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic - we walked everywhere. The staff were amazing with our children. Homely feel to the hotel. We did get a discounted rate as it was booked for us by regulars. Breakfast in the hotel was lovely and there are also great little cafe's very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience, avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Giampitoscana
Reviews.Content: Room size like a grave (under 8 sq meters!!) , cold and rude welcome and a water pump close to the wall of my bed running all night!! Three good reasons to avoid definitely this expensive and horrible place.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in London!”
Reviews.Author: 187514Hugh
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment: we thought that Tophams Hotel would be tip top. It was dreadful. Perhaps some of the many problems could have been resolved if the staff spoke English but since this was not the case nothing was done. The room was cold, the carpet was not clean and the lighting was faulty. How this dump can be described as a 4 star hotel is beyond belief. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Our experience was different to all the others”
Reviews.Author: FazandBrads
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying in the Tophams hotel after being given a theatre break with hotel included as a wedding present. My sister didn't check Tripadvisor before she booked it and then suddenly had a huge panic when she read the reviews days later. She rang the hotel to check that we were actually staying in the hotel itself and not being carted off elsewhere like it seems everyone else is. We arrived at the the hotel armed with this knowledge and were prepared not to take an nonsense from them. However, when we got there we were greeted by a friendly receptionist and the downstairs lobby and dining area are very well decorated and welcoming. We went to our room up the lift in the same building. Admittedly the room is small, like you would expect for London but it was tastefully decorated we have no complaints about any aspect of the room at all. I would suggest that if you were to stay here you check where you are staying beforehand. The location of this hotel is so handy and we enjoyed our stay. Its really unfortunate that other people have had such a bad experience. The hotel need to get their act together and either do the other buildings up or stick to the number of rooms that they have available that are up to standard. We had a lovely weekend, but with the mixed reviews from others it would be difficult to recommend it to any one as you wouldn't know what you were sending people to.

Reviews.Title: “dont book bf reading all reviews on trip advisor”
Reviews.Author: eleni_viglaki
Reviews.Content: I regret not reading reviews on trip advisor first but I as in a hurry when I booked a room at this hotel. I made the booking of the room which was non refundable. Then we got there at 22.00. They said they didnt have a room even though they had charged my credit card with 200 pounds.The customers at the lobby were ladies at 40s goggling and laughing, they seemed so cheap as to stay at the hotel for some evening hours not thw whole night (if you know what I mean.) again this is what I thought when I saw them. In the end they sent us to a "sister hotel", and didnt even pay for the taxi as they had promised. At the other hotel noone cared about us, the room was cold and as I said we paid the money in advance, even though this was supposed to be a worse hotel, and we should have paid less money. I regret even having visited this place, and I hope the management of the hotel wont bother me with apologies since now I now this is what they do for living. Moking potential customes. As I see it they already got customers, why need more?

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in!!!”
Reviews.Author: sbrown328
Reviews.Content: As a regular traveler with business I stay in a lot of hotels and have frequented a large number of London based ones. I have got to say this THE worst hotel I've stayed in from a long time. After a promising check-in at a rather plush reception the experience went quickly downhill. The hotel is spread across multiple buildings along the street and I was escorted to Number 50 - Room 8. The room itself was appalling. The carpet was badly stained and did not look clean, the shower flooded when used, the tap was falling off the basin, the laminate in the bathroom was moldy and bubbled, it was noisy - you could hear every other room in the building being used, every tap turned on, every door closed. The final straw was when the bed collapsed as I sat on it! I mentioned all this at check out and the only comment was, no-one had mentioned any of the problems before AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not a great 4* hotel at all (more like a 1* hotel)”
Reviews.Author: gcxbjames
Reviews.Content: Nicely located near Victoria Station and surrounded by many breakfast cafes and dinning restaurants. However, our experience staying 5 nights at the Tophams was far from great. We booked the deluxe king room which provided a double bed. However, this was our experience: the room was far from king size and provided a terrible 'spongy' mattress, very bad TV cable reception, water leaks in both bedroom and bathroom, and mildew here and there. And to our surprise there's no sound proofing between foors and rooms, this is unacceptable for a 4* hotel. Some hostels can be better and far cheaper... Business centre is equipped with a PC and two printers, but only the PC works. So don't expect to print your own boarding pass, etc. such details would need to be email edto the Tophams front desk... also their DVD selection is limited and films are dated. Very expensive hotel and not good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst experiences ever”
Reviews.Author: Gaby080
Reviews.Content: I got 2 options> Room in the annexe (not vacuumed, no light, plastic foil on the bathroom floor, no elevator) or room without facilities but with light! (but no coat hangers, glasses, hairdryer, and almost no space to put my feet on the ground) The sheets had been used before. I guess this hotel is used for hourly purposes!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: JgwGeneva
Reviews.Content: All the reviews I have read since I booked this hotel are correct. I was shown my room in the annex hotel along the street and immediately asked to change room. The room (no 12) was a basement room with NO windows and no working ventilation, no bedside tables, and no mirror, and painted brown all over. The person who showed me the room told me it wasn't possible to move. I went back to the main hotel and complained politely, they took me back to the annex, and showed me room no 11, also a basement room, horrible and again, no working ventilation. The basement of this hotel has a very strong smell of damp. I explained them that I understood it was against the law not to have some form of ventilation. They said they would fix it the next day, I said that would be too late. I left and went to the appointment I had, and when I returned, they showed me a single room in the same building, which they told me I wouldn't like, they were right, it was the most depressing hotel room I have ever seen. Eventually I asked if I could leave the hotel and not be charged, they said they hadn't charged my card and this was up to 'lastminute' to decide if I would be charged. I took my case and went back to Victoria Station and found a single room at the Grosvenor Hotel. I will probably have to pay double for that night, but nothing could induce me to stay in the rooms offered at the Topham Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel for London getaway!”
Reviews.Author: jjoslen
Reviews.Content: This is a great small hotel. I have stayed several times and will repeat again. The location is fantastic, a quick 5 minute walk from Victoria Station. Rooms are small (VERY typical in most all hotels of London) but very clean, comfortable and inviting. I find the staff to be accommodating and kind. As the hotel is popular, I recommend reconfirming reservations and advising ahead of time if you are expecting a late arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Listen to your customers!!”
Reviews.Author: DellaNice
Reviews.Content: I was having to stay overnight in Victoria at short notice due to netting over running and had to be back first thing. Popped in here as a colleague had said it was fine. It wasn't. I was disappointed after handing over my card for Â£250 room only. The room was so small you wouldn't believe. I cannot believe hotels like this area able to operate in such poor condition. This hotel is nowhere near three star never mind four. The lighting was very dim as was the chap at reception when I asked to change rooms. He said he couldn't authorise it and I demanded he come to my room to inspect the damp patch on the wall. It was disgusting. I wrote to the manager and never received an acknowledgement or response. Yet again, another hotel ripping people off. My advice is to steer clear.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: WolverhamptonCallan
Reviews.Content: Certainly not a 4 star. Reception inviting but then we were taken down the road to an awful downstairs room. Entrance hall had an unpleasant smell. Could have cried when we entered the room. It was so bare. Three small lamps which gave hardly any light at all. Net curtains didn't pull across, stains on the carpet, small blood stains on the net. Bathroom, if you could call it that, was up a step and into a plastic unit which we presumed had been fitted into a wardrobe space. The basin was tiny, tap had part missing,shower was broken and no roller for the toilet roll. We were going to complain to the manager but he never was there . Were also woken on our first morning by we presumed plubing noises and the last straw on the second morning the one curtain and pole fell down. Did tell manager but non apologies.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: Smudger1
Reviews.Content: Booked a double room through Booking.com based on room descriptions, photos and star ratings. Arrived to be shown a room which so small you couldn't open the wardrobe doors because of the bed and you had to share a bathroom on landing! Said needed my own ensuite (as per room description) and shown a basement room in a building down the road which just stank of damp! Reception was full of people complaining and can understand why! Dont stay here!

Reviews.Title: “The Topham Hotel - To online booking agents like booking.com, please read and believe the customer reviews!”
Reviews.Author: miagapuz
Reviews.Content: I went to London for my Masters Class in Digital Marketing. It was fashion week and all the hotels are fully booked. I tried looking for a good, clean and safe hotel that is on the average price per day right after I landed in London. I was able to get a room at Park Plaza in Victoria, but only for 2 days. So as soon as I landed to London, I decided to look for another hotel where I can transfer on the 3rd day. Most booking websites recommended Tophams hotel whenever my hotel of choice is not available. Tophams is a " 4-star hotel", according to these booking sites and that the price per room per night is a premium at the average of 400 pounds. I was aware of the bad reviews this hotel has been getting from travellers but I didnt have any choice at that time. So I booked for 2 nights, amounting to approx 800 pounds. When I got in the hotel, I was greeted by their nice staff. The receptionist however was a big scammer. When I got into Tophams, she gave me a room with no bathroom. When I told her I will transfer to another hotel because they were giving me the room that's not what I reserved and paid online, she pretended to change the room to fit my choice. I later found out that she did not give me a room at Tophams, but instead she brought me to an adjacent inn called Belgrave. That Belgrave connected to Tophams looked as if it's part of Tophams. Each unit has its own entrance and I was surprised that each unit has an upper and ground level rooms. I was brought on the upper level and when I entered the room I was shocked. The door was small and made of unfinished wood, no internet, that means I need to go out in the cold and enter the main lobby of Tophams to get an internet access. I was so suffocating. I immediately told the staff that I need to leave the room to find another one. The staff was polite and told me "I understand." Maybe they are used to hearing musings from disappointed clients. I requested to the receptionist to cancel the amount she swiped on my card but she declined. She told me their policy is non-refundable. I told her that she did not give me a room at Tophams but in its adjacent Belgrave Inn. So she should not apply their terms and policies as they are the one in breach. To cut the story short, I left without them refunding my money. I suggest to booking.com, hotels.com and other booking sites that they should not include this hotel anymore as I felt scammed, as well as the many travelers victimized before me. So, I learned that before I hand my card next time, I will ask to have a look at the rooms first to be sure. Aside from the fees, this scamming receptionist charged a PREAUTHORIZATION charge of 100 pounds. She told me it is not charged at all from my card. She told me that 3x when I was registering. I even asked her for clarification about it. I later found out that my card was charged with that amount. I should've followed my intuition when I read the policies of this hotel when I was booking online. It says "non- refundable". I remember, when I checked in at Park Plaza which is really a 4star hotel, they charged my card upon check out and not during check in. Watch out for this clever receptionist she is very tricky. Once I arrived, she swiped my card immediately and gave me rooms which does not exist in their website.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not a four star”
Reviews.Content: On arrival checked in which was quite simple and headed for our room. Quite dissapoointed as was very very small. Room was nicely decorated, bed looked lovely and clean, but ceiling had large water mark on it. There was two of us and it was difficult to maneouvre around the bed. TV picture was good, lots of channels except channel 5. Tea making facilities dire. Whilst you had kettle and tea, albeit "special" teas which we didn't like. No ordinary tea bags, no milk. Had to go and buy t-bags and milk in order to get decent cup of tea. Furniture ok but showing very obvious signs of wear. Air conditioning was though very good. Stteep steps down to the shower (bit dangerous for the older person) which is over the bath which was difficult to get in and out of. Distinct lack of toilet paper and we had to buy more. Stayed one night, the following morning my other half was going to mention to the receptionist these points but on exiting the hotel was unalble to approach reception as the seat was taken up by a foreign looking chap i(the boss I think) in a suit who seemed to be telling the reptionist off. We left the hotel and returned later, in fact we were in and out throughout our stay and he was always there and there was no way you felt you could interrupt. Would I stay here again, the answer would be no. Location is good, but I am used to better and have in the past paid a lot less and got far more for my money.

Reviews.Title: “not clean, breach of contract”
Reviews.Author: citytraveller014
Reviews.Content: They never had anything that they promised on their web site. There was no internet, no air conditioning, and the room was very smelly. There are many clients in the lobby complaining to the manager when checking out, but the manager seemed to care nothing. I strongly recommend NOT to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4-star but no major complaints”
Reviews.Author: Rh_Hfx
Reviews.Content: Our room was small but otherwise acceptable. I'd not consider this a 4-star hotel but neither was it as bad as other reviews indicated. Only 2 complaints, 2 burned out or missing bulbs and a cluster of dirt between the shower stall and the wall. The front office staff treated us very well and I expect would have dealt with these problems had we felt they were bad enough to complain. Excellent location (especially those arriving from Gatwick) with Victoria Station just a 5 minute walk away. Would stay at the Topham again.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a little help, not bad but could be alot better for the price”
Reviews.Author: lawake2009
Reviews.Content: I was asked by the receptionist on arrival to write a review on Trip Advisor, which makes me think that the hotel staff read the comments, therefore coming from the hotel industry myself and managing such hotels I thought I would come up with a few helpful tips along the way. When making my reservation online, I called to check a few things, when I did the guy over the telephone wanted to get rid of me so fast. Maybe you should look to implement a level of call service, try calling other chain hotels you will get the idea from this. Upon arrival at the hotel we was greeted by a lady sat behind a very large desk, who when checking us in stayed in her seat?? Iâ€™m sure this is not of her own fault, since there was two other reception staff I saw doing the same. This did make the service seem rather impersonal. I would get rid of the large desk and put a higher smaller desk in the corner, which would also hide your background area, and also allow you to have better security for your money rather than an envelope in a draw?? The lady was pleasant and offered us an upgrade in room, which I felt was only done since she wanted a good review on here? At first glance the room looked very nice, lovely designs and space. However, a few things were noticed after, for instance chips in the bath, tiles in the bathroom not finished off to a good standard, breaks and chips in them. Plus the wall paper had marks on it, overall nice outside look but not finished off to a good standard, or not maintained to a good standard. Which made me think are you classified? I think this is something you should invest some time looking into, since you would know how to close the gap between customers expected and perceived quality, very important in order to benchmark yourself in a very competitive market like London. I hope this has been helpful, but not disheartening to prospective customers since everyone is only human and in order to learn from mistakes you have to have someone to show you when and where you are going wrong, in order to identify and rectify. I urge the hotels owners to sit in the rooms they offer for an hour and then notice these simple things which could allow them to earn so much more out of the business and ensure customer loyalty. I stayed in room number 5 if that helps?

Reviews.Title: “Great location for transport around the city with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: carlitoscott
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site, we weren't sure what to expect from this hotel. It turns out it was just what we were looking for. It is a five minute walk from Victoria train station, which is ideal to get around the city. We were met by very friendly and helpful staff. The room was small but beautifully decorated. We would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a city trip or shopping trip. Thank you, to everyone at Tophams, for our pleasant stay. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - just few minutes from Victoria”
Reviews.Author: DmitryBrighton
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel with very modern, comfortable rooms - exactly as in description/pictures. My room was with a big and comfortable double bed (actually, I've booked a single room but got a free upgrade to double, thanks! :) ), a very lovely view over the green garden, large TV (100 channels), free and fast internet, excellently fitted bathroom. Staff was very helpful, smiley and pleasant, really seems that they are doing everything for the guest to make him happy. Conclusion: ideal hotel if you want to stay somewhere near Victoria station (central London), excellent value for money. Stayed in few other hotels near Victoria before - but this one is the best, without any doubts. Will definitely stop there again soon. So surprised about the hotel rating here, it definitely deserves more!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother there are better places for same price! !”
Reviews.Author: dicky1980SheffieldUk
Reviews.Content: The positive of this hotel is the location- quiet street but really close to Victoria station and attractions. All the staff look like they just arrived from Bosnia and have the attitude towards customer service that would be welcomed in belson. The rooms are tiny, and I mean tiny! You only get the complimentary mini bar if you booked the hotel directly with them not from an online agent. It's Â£2 for a can of coke otherwise! I even went to to the desk and showed them their own web site on my I pad and they were having none of it! I had to pay for my coke without any apology. Our shower leaked because the reception staff phoned us in the room complaining the people below had water running down the Walls. We also had a massive damp patch on the wall in our room. The staff make you feel uneasy and I wouldn't trust them at all. I will never return here. I took a chance as I got a good deal from last minute web site. Please learn from my mistake and go else where. They try and charge your card for stuff you've nit had or used either! I just wish I worked for trading standards!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Done”
Reviews.Author: Lindi100
Reviews.Content: Just come back from Tophams and having booked it as a top secret hotel and not knowing the name of the hotel until after we paid I was horrified by the reviews! I rang the hotel and told them that we definately wanted twin beds (travelling with a friend), an ensuite that was attached to the room and didn't want a basement room. Was really worried what we would find on arrival but we were very pleasantly surprised. The reception area is small but very smart. The room, on the ground floor (No 6), was a good size with a well exquiped ensuite with separate bath and shower. Two velvet upholstered chairs and a small backless sofa and a small tale made the room comfortable to sit in and it was very nicely decorated. The staff all seemed to be foreign and not very well informed (we were 5 mins from Buckingham Palace on foot but the receptionist didn't know which way to turn out of the hotel! But they were helpful and courteous. I know everyone's experience of a hotel is different but ours was good thankfully and, like I said, we were very pleasantly surprised, having expected the worst. We were walking distance from almost everything, we walked, with bags the short distance from Victoria bus station, we walked the short distance to Buckingham Place, through St James Park to Trafalgar Square, up the Strand to Covenant Gardens and up th Shaftsbury Avenue to the Theatre, then back down Charing Cross Road to Trafalgar Square down the Mall to the Palace and back to the hotel. We were footsore at the end but the location is excellent and you don't need to be taking tubes and taxis everywhere. There are plenty of places to eat if you go to the top of Edbury Street and across the Road there are fast food shops bars and restaurants (its a stones throw from Buckingham Palace in tourist land so you get the picture) but Edbury Street is really quiet and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE DO NOT BOOK”
Reviews.Author: kitspice
Reviews.Content: What can i tell you was supposed to be a special night as going off for the day from Victoria the next morning it was my partners birthday treat - arrived at Tophams was told room had been double booked along with 5 Yes 5 other bookings they attempted to find alternative accommodation failed so I had to travel back home and make the journey back into London the following day NOT HAPPY - Four weeks later and I am still trying to get my money back - no-one is interested I think this hotel is a scam they take your money don't provide the service and then you can't get hold of anyone to refund your money - I am going to take them to court and get trading standard involved - VERY UPSETTING - Damn wish I'd checked trip advisor before I booked

Reviews.Title: “rubbish waste of money and its freezing very poor dont stay here !!”
Reviews.Author: charlotteselondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed new years eve it was freezing in the room damp the lost of problems is endless we got "upgraded " to the kensington one which was even worse I would never ever recommened this hotel give me a holiday inn anyday over this dump its not worth money and as for the managerment not repling to repeated letters of complantant is discusting! oh and u wont get molton brown products so dont be fooled !

Reviews.Title: “HORRENDOUS - TAKE NOTE OF THE REVIEWS!”
Reviews.Author: bunny091
Reviews.Content: 4 stars?? The website said air conditioning - none, dvd player - none, safe - none, minibar - none, elevators none - we had to drag our suitcases up 43 stairs. Wifi advertised but there wasn't any. The room was very hot, the toilet made a horrible noise when you flushed it, the taps were wonky in the bathroom, the shower didn't drain and the kettle was full of disgusting murky scum. There was rubbish stuffed everywhere. The staff were also rude and unhelpful. Location was good and comfortable beds but this wasn't worth paying alot of money for.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest and to close for comfort”
Reviews.Author: 32655Alicia123
Reviews.Content: We booked a room big enough for a family of 5 at Knightsbridge and were told upon arrival no available room. They instead offered us 2 rooms at Topham. The rooms were soooo small that you could barely walk around the bed. At first they tried to put us in the basement where smelled musty. When I complained about the fact we paid 400 pounds and these rooms were not equal and should receive partial refund, I was told each room at this hotel is 400 pounds and I was receiving a deal by having 2 rooms. When looked on website this was wrong information. Customer service horendous and rooms small. Not at all recommended for people with children.

Reviews.Title: “What on earth would overseas visitors make of this shambles???”
Reviews.Author: Nigel129
Reviews.Content: My wife and recently graduated daughter booked this hotel the night before a trip on the Orient Express to celebrate my birthday. We arrived from Norfolk by train on perhaps the hottest day of the year. Check in was conducted by various people, all from overseas although they all spoke reasonable English in a humourless manner. We also had to pay in full at check in, and leave a Â£100 credit card charge against any further expenses in the restaurant or mini bar. Never been asked for that anywhere else, and I am still checking our credit card bill religiously to check there haven't been any charges put against it. On looking for our rooms, the lift bizarrely only goes up one floor so we had to carry our bags up and through a maze of corridors. Our daughter had a single room on the top floor, and having stayed in hotels all over the world, I could not imagine a smaller room in which to spend the night. There was a window, but the aircon, essential in the heat, was so noisy she had to turn it off to sleep. We had a double, one floor down, which was OK although the very small bathroom was up some stairs via an area with a desk in it complete with hair dryer. We checked out the next morning, didn't bother with breakfast, admitting to one bottle of water from the minibar for which we paid cash, although finding some change for a fiver was a bit of a problem. The man at reception said they destroyed the credit card slips produced the day before if no expenses had been incurred. Nevertheless, a few days later, like the previous reviewer, we had an email from the internet hotel agency we always use for hotels all over the world telling us the hotel had reported us as "no shows", and they were demanding Â£263 for the two rooms!! Having emailed the agency concerned, and having retained all our receipts, we appear to have avoided this scam, but we have since been charged Â£1 on our credit card - if all guests are charged Â£1, and don't challenge it, it's a nice little earner! An email to the Manager has produced no reponse. Never again!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: cfcfan1937
Reviews.Content: We booked several weeks in advance and arrived on schedule. However, after returning home the booking agent notified us that we were being billed and extra GBP164.00 for not arriving as scheduled. The location, near Victoria Station is great and the bed was comfortable, but the service was atrocious. The coffee pot leaked, there was no cream or powdered cream for the coffee. There were only three coat hangers in the closet and despite repeated requests we were told that no more were available. The shower in the bathroom was too small, the door didn't fit and water sprayed on to the floor. Also, there was only one very small piece of soap - inadequate for two people for three days. More soap was provided the second day - not by the maid service but only after we asked for it. The grout between the tiles in the bathroom was coming loose and posed a hazard to bare feet when stepped upon. They charged GBP150 in advance for extras we might use, such as the mini-bar and breakfast. We didn't use anything and found a great place just down the road to have breakfast at less than half the price the Tophams Hotel charges (GBP14.95). The staff, all of whom seem to be of various different nationalities except English were at best very curt, and sometimes positively rude. We cannot recommend this hotel and will not go there again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst customer service I've ever experienced!!!”
Reviews.Author: seb2010
Reviews.Content: Having read the terrible reviews for this hotel I was worried about my stay to say the least, however the booking couldn't be cancelled. We arrived to be greeted by an extremely rude receptionist who told us that the twin rooms we'd booked were no longer available and the best she could do was double rooms.... not great unless you're prepared to sleep in the same bed as your travelling partners!! We were given free breakfast instead. She didn;t crack a smile once and was very rude. She also insisted there was no manager she could speak to about the problem.... She must deal with complaints a lot as her speach was perfect...almost robotic!! One room was nice, the air con didn't work in the other and one room was damp and smelt musty. The rooms were very small. The receptionist also attempted to take a Â£100 deposit from each of us in case we used the mini bar!!! The hotel is in a really good location but is very let down by the poor customer service and bad attitude of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A box with no bathroom ...”
Reviews.Author: 7r4v3ll3r
Reviews.Content: .. is what I got for my night stay in Tophams for 144Â£. I've stayed in hundreds of hotels all over the globe and this stay was undoubtedly the worst value for money I've ever experienced. The single room was incredibly tiny. Even in Tokyo I got way bigger rooms for the same amount of money. It was indeed just an over-sized wardrobe drawer. The room had no bathroom or toilets en-suite! I had to go a floor up to get to "my" bathroom. Yes, "my" bathroom, since when I checked in the receptionist lied with a straight face that I will be the only one using this bathroom. As it turned out, at least three 09 rooms (109, 209 and 309) share the same bathroom. 144Â£ for a box and a hostel-like bathroom sharing. They also make sure you pay the bill on check-in :) They already know why. Since it was for one night I did not want to lose my nerves by complaining. I checked out as quickly as possible the next morning never to return again (it also turned out they did not have a record of my payment and wanted to charge me AGAIN, so DO keep the receipt!). STAY AWAY from this hotel. Yes, London is full of little, stinky, overvalued holes, but this one definitely top(ham)s them all.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky little dump”
Reviews.Author: alpes2003
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever had the misfortune to encounter. I booked and expected a luxury hotel with many amenities. In actuality we were presented with was a tiny room in a smelly basement in a separate building away from the main hotel, that had minimal facilities. We looked a a few other rooms, all similarly awful. The price, although discounted, was still higher than it should be for this apology for a hotel. The staff were completely disdainful. DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOVEL.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting hotel”
Reviews.Author: ninrak
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel just before midnight, and they has been informed about late arrival. We got a disgusting basement room, with awful smell. First thing in the morning we went to reception and asked new and better room. We got another, which was proper room in "main" hotel. We stayed 4 nights and every day we heard the same complaints about disgusting rooms and that hotel was over-booked. I will never go to that hotel of frauds again.

Reviews.Title: “T E R R I B L E N I G H T M A R E !!! D O N T G O T H E R E !!!”
Reviews.Author: kostohryz
Reviews.Content: Hotel is overbooked every day.They send customers to different hotels without any apology.It was NOT a coincidence,they do it on purpose!They charge your credit card first and then they send you to another hotel where you have to pay again.We argued 3 days to get the refund.Dont leave hotel without refound receipt!It is not a 4 star hotel!!!Staff at reception is rude and unprofessional and constantly lying.Rooms dirty and were not ready at checkin. Equipment not as 4 star hotel.Breakfast poor and not worth the money,the waitress chaotic!The manager is totally incompetent and not able to organize anything. They charge your credit card by checkin not by checkout.They require an extra Â£50 deposit for minibar and other potentials. If they send to their sister hotel Knightsbrigde, DONT go there it is even worse!

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: charlottet076
Reviews.Content: Me and my pertner arrived at Tophams hotel at 3.30pm, well after check-in time. There was a couple at receptiopn complaining about the room situation and we waitied over 10minutes just lwatching before one of the other eceptionists decided to offer their help to us. We had reserved a spaceon-line prior to arrival but suprise, suprise, there were no rooms available. After arguing our case, they decided we did have a room but that we'd have to wait in thwe bar area for our room. Meanwhiel the couple were still kicking offa bout the state of their room. After another half hour wait, I asked how lonhg it was going to take to check in and we were told to take a seat as the yhad to get someone in to clean the room first. Another 20minutes and we were finally shown to our '4 star room' It was in the basement an the walls were all painted dark brown. It was small and all that was in there was a bed and a mirror rested against the wall. Needless to say we were straight back to reception to complain. The lady behind reception said that she could move us to another hotel in Euston and she was already organizing it for the other couple. We went to Tophams because of the location so we just asked if we could have a refund. The lady was still on the phone but said yes and that it would be sorted that night. She then went on to say that we might as well leave because if we waited for her to get off the phone, she was only going to apologize and it wasn't realyl worth it. We were both furious and needless to say it spoiled our whole evening. NEVER AGAIN. Theyse people clearly have no clue as to the definition of customer service and I genuinley can't grasp how the hell they got 4 stars to their name!?!?

Reviews.Title: “Seriously....do NOT stay here.. the worse hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: LisaCornwall_UK
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the very nice reception area at 8.30am to check-in and leave a bag as I assumed they would not have my room ready. Advised them I would be back much later that evening and assumed everything was fine. Finally returned at 11pm to be greeted by a young receptionist who seemed quite sheepish to see me and announced she would take me to my room. I said that wouldn't be necessary and then realised she was heading out the door. I stopped and asked where are we going and she told me they were oversold and I would be staying in their sister property a few doors down the street. I protested politely as was too tired to do otherwise and she told me to speak to the management in the morning. I was then shown to what can only be described as the worse room (No. 5) I have ever had the misfortune to stay in. The teeny bathroom must have been an old built in wardrobe, the room was grubby, dirty, grim, the kettle didn't work and worse of all, the door out onto the small balcony would not close properly so then spent a restless night wondering who would be coming through to visit me as I lay there in this awful room. I am only grateful I was up and out very early the following morning and wanted to share my experience with fellow travellers as I wouldn't recommend this hotel to my worst enemy!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: jacqui011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tophams Hotel and will never stay there again. There was no mirror or power points in the bathroom. One of the shower doors was missing and water leaked all over the floor. We had to ask for soap, shampoo and toilet paper. The internet didn't work in our room. We complained and they offered us a 15% discount, but we had prepaid, so we never got our 15% refund and they won't responded to my emails. Do yourself a favour - don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, unreasonable, untidy, dirty and nothing like the website except the reception!!”
Reviews.Author: Bee39
Reviews.Content: I booked into this hotel for my graduation so it was supposed to be a special evening...arrived at 8 in the evening to frop bags off before dinner. We had booked a twin room and paid to find out the only room available was a double with no bed side tables or bathroom!!! no spologies and very rude staff, they tried to pass us on to the hotel in Chelsea which also has terrible reviews. The rooms were nothing like the ones in the pictures and the carpets were filthy, please don't book this hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but rooms too small and service poor”
Reviews.Author: Timfor
Reviews.Content: A smallish hotel close to Victoria station. We booked a premium king room which was mis-repesented, as it was tiny. The small rooms are well furnished and the air-conditioning is good. The breakfast room is quaint. The housekeeping staff managed to forget something like towels every day, and it took many calls to reception to have the matter rectified. The staff appeared to be continually arguing with dissatisfied clients.

Reviews.Title: “Do not ever book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Morfinnegan
Reviews.Content: I have no idea what the facilities are like.
